results.description:
A Shamanic journey of ancient remembering. A healing ceremony of the Soul lead by Kevon Simpson. Building Brotherhood is a men only Light Of Iris healing event.

What is Light Of Iris?


Love Includes Growing Heights Together of Integration Responsibility Intuition and Simplicity. Light of Iris is a Shamanic healing ceremony that uses meditation, journaling, dance, drawing, music, and .... more to help facilitate lasting emotional healing and a permanent expansion of consciousness. For some that means increased creativity, for others that can mean healing deeply repressed childhood wounds in a matter of hours, for some it can mean reawakening a connection to ones ancestors and their power. It is named after my late Great Grandmother Iris Palmer who came to me in a vision as pure light during a previous ceremony. I don't have the right words to describe the impact that had on me, but we do want to share that possibility with others. This is about remembering who you are and standing in that power. To honor the privacy of our participants. No further information regarding the nature of this healing experience will be posted here. Joining this invite does not guarantee your participation. Please send a message to find out more information, register and be added to the list.

We love you,
Team Iris
results.name: Building Brotherhood LOI Full Moon Ceremony

results.description:
Open topic group run by a trained facilitator for individuals and their partners who identify as transgender, transsexual, cross-dresser, gender variant, or intersex. Takes place the 2nd and 4th Saturdays of each month, starts at 7:30 pm.

The 2nd Saturday is a discussion group and the 4th Saturday is an activity group.

No charge to attend, but a $5.00 donation is welcome.

Please note: Meet-up.com is used to help promote this group and the RSVPs on Meet-up do not accurately reflect the actual attendance of the group.

results.description:
PLEASE READ ALL THE DETAILS BEFORE YOU RSVP. 3RD PARTY TICKET REQUIRED.

From its Off-Broadway debut at Studio 54 comes, Peaches and Crime’s THE MAN WHO DIED! Join us for this all original, interactive “You-Pick-the-Action” style murder mystery musical modelled after the golden age of radio! At four critical points in the plot, the audience will be polled to determine how events will unfold! From a Manhattan skyscraper, to the Island of Skulls! You decide what happens! Who to interrogate? Even who done it? Be part of the fun! Be part of the action of Peaches and Crime’s THE MAN WHO DIED!

On stage, this act never passes up an opportunity for dramatic flourish, comic antics, or sophisticated charm. From murder ballads to torch songs, calypso tunes to drinking songs, no style is unfamiliar to these eclectic entertainers. Colorful costumes, diverse instrumentation and flashy dances make any Peaches & Crime show well worth the cost of admission. Each individual’s talents are shown to their finest, and together they wow even the most jaded dance-hall connoisseur.

This is a "band" that gives a performance like no other. Part Vaudeville, part old-time radio, part murder mystery. I think it will be something like we have never seen before. Tickets for the show can be purchased by clicking here for $14. Food and drink is available for additional. Many of you know this is my favorite roadhouse!

Show starts at 9. Let's meet at 8 to ensure we can sit together and mingle.

PLEASE DO NOT RSVP UNTIL YOU BOUGHT YOUR TICKET(s). Then confirm through message or comment that you did so I can tell them an accurate number of seats to reserve. You will be able to pay $20 at the door, but I can't guarantee seating with the group.


<<DO NOT WAIT! THIS SHOW WILL SELL OUT! JUST GET OUT AND DO IT!>>

As always, if you cannot make, no need to post why. We understand and will catch you next time.
results.name: MURDER MYSTERY MUSICAL!

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!
results.how_to_find_us: 5th Floor, on W40th between 7th & 8th ave.
results.name: Music Open Jam @ Funkadelic Studios

group.name: Open Jams NYC at Funkadelic Studios

Join us for a night of inspiring music that spans genres and a contagiously high energy vibe to keep your body moving in a friendly, exciting, judgement-free zone. We hope you'll join us!

New York Insight Meditation Center

28 West 27th St., 10th Floor (Buzzer #27)

NYC


***SCHEDULE***

7:30-8:00 Setup

8:00-10:00 Freestyle dancing

10:00-10:15 Community announcement circle

10:15-11:30 Freestyle dancing continues

***WE NEED VOLUNTEERS***

Pitch in to run the dance! Help with set-up, do a door shift, or help with take-down, and get $5 off admission - do two of the above and get in free. Suggested donation for entry - $10-15.

***EASY TO GET TO***

Nearby trains: 1, 6, F, M, R, N

Map & Directions: 

https://goo.gl/maps/FetZv74cKnM2


***FOR THOSE COMING IN BY CAR***


There's on-street parking for those coming in from out of town. Just a short ride in from the Lincoln Tunnel. 


Spread the word!

results.description:
Join us for another night of dinner, drinks and great comedy at The Room at Dizzy’s on 5th ave. It's a Bar/Event Space that has Live Jazz, Blues, Stand-Up Comedy, Open- Mics & much more. I booked an awesome DJ and a hilarious lineup of stand up comedians paired with delicious Dizzy’s Diner food and great drinks. Its always tons of fun and a great way to meet your fellow Slopers!


Tickets are $10 at the door, $7 in advance if you use the discount code: 'southslope'. You can purchase advance tickets here: 

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-frizzy-dizzy-comedy-show-april-edition-tickets-24627389184

Please note: the cover charge is simply to reimburse my expenses i.e., DJ, performers, tipping the bartender, etc. I hope to see some of you there!

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's  newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

Lexington's Lounge at The Cort Hotel is a classy, sophisticated and upscale lounge without the attitude!  It is one of our favorite gathering spots in the city! Please join us for this special night out will get to meet other members and friends  in a comfortable and casual atmosphere.  We'll have staff on hand to welcome you and live DJ music played at conversational levels beginning at 9pm.

Here is what to expect:

results.description:
Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Beautiful Turf Field - Friendly but competitive game. 

RSVP's open 6 Days before the Meetup at 8:00pm - 


RSVP's close at 6:00pm the night of the game

Main goal is the have fun, play hard, and have a good time. 

Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait list if they show up.

(1) we are keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side; rotating new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot.

(3) Games will be 40-45 minute halves; switching sides at the break. 

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

Fee is $4.00 for the night - Payment will be taken at Half-Time. Please have cash available to pay. If you do not have cash, please go to the ATM prior the game. All players will receive a 1-time exception.
results.how_to_find_us: Park is right off of Kent Ave + N 10th St. - (L) Bedford Ave, or (G) Nassau Ave
results.name: Full-Field Soccer - Co-ed - 11 v 11 - Large Goals

results.description:
It's time again for one of our most popular Meetups! As seen on ABC News, a Nuts & Bolts Mixer is a unique, slightly sexy & great way to meet upscale, outgoing & friendly singles!

Don't "screw" yourself out of the chance to find your right "fit". You'd be "nuts" not to attend. P.S. No "tools" allowed :)

Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/nutsboltsparty/dates/Apr-23-2016_at_0830PM

Drink Specials & Snacks:


• 2 For 1 Drinks (8:30-9:30pm)

• FREE Shot for all members birthdays this month

• FREE Snacks for all Meetup members & guests


Ice Breakers:

• You will either receive a nut or a bolt

• The object is to find the nut that fits the bolt

• Return matching hardware to bar & receive a FREE shot


Music & Giveaways:

• DJ on lower level spins best dance music

• VJ on upper level plays videos at conversational level

• FREE Giveaways & Prizes for Meetup members

Admission:

$10 first 10 tix w/ discount code "NUTS" at checkout 

Get tix here -https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/nutsboltsparty/dates/Apr-23-2016_at_0830PM

$15 online after that, $20 at the door w/ RSVP, $25 w/o   

Is this venue private for Meetup? Yes. The entire venue will be 100% private for our members and their guests. 

Is this age or ethnic specific? No. This is not an age or ethnic specific event. We get a good mix and a wide range of ages.  

Can I come alone? Yes.  Most come on their own. You can come alone or bring friends - either way you will have a great time. 

How many people will attend? We are partnering with other Meetup groups so the RSVP's shown here are only a small portion of the members attending.  We'll expect 200+ member to attend as in our past Nuts & Bolts Meetup Mixers.
results.how_to_find_us: Party is private for members and their guests - optional name tags will be provided
results.name: Nuts & Bolts Singles Mixer! 2-1 Drinks, DJ, VJ, Ice Breakers, Giveaways, Snacks)

• You will either receive a nut or a bolt

• DJ on lower level spins best dance music 

• VJ on upper level plays videos at conversational level

$15 online after that, $20 at the door w/ RSVP, $25 w/o   

Is this venue private for Meetup? Yes. The entire venue will be 100% private for our members and their guests. 

Is this age or ethnic specific? No. This is not an age or ethnic specific event. We get a good mix and a wide range of ages.  

Can I come alone? Yes.  Most come on their own. You can come alone or bring friends - either way you will have a great time. 

How many people will attend? We are partnering with other Meetup groups so the RSVP's shown here are only a small portion of the members attending.  We'll expect 200+ member to attend as in our past Nuts & Bolts Meetup Mixers.

results.description:
We’ve been having a great time at all the different Cocktail Parties that “Bob’s Groups” have had at the many different locations all over Westchester County.

One thing I have been asked a lot though is, “How about having a Mix & Mingle on a Saturday night”, being some people can’t make it during the week. So, here you go. A nice laid back setting to meet and talk to people the way it’s meant to be on a Saturday night.


Ichiro is located right on the Main Strip in White Plains.

Sleekly designed Asian fusion restaurants with a beautiful large lounge area!



AND FEEL FREE TO INVITE FRIENDS.


And as always, please take care of the wait staff, thanks.

THERE ARE MANY MORE MEMBERS COMING FROM OTHER GROUPS, HERE'S TWO OF THEM........  

http://www.meetup.com/Westchester-Singles/events/230376690/

…..AND….http://www.meetup.com/Sexy-Singles-Going-Wild/events/230376837/



Looking forward to seeing everyone!

Bob
results.how_to_find_us: You'll see me as you enter.
results.name: ~COCKTAILS & CONVERSATION on a SATURDAY NIGHT @ ICHIRO in WHITE PLAINS~

We’ve been having a great time at all the different Cocktail Parties that “Bob’s Groups” have had at the many different locations all over Westchester County.

One thing I have been asked a lot though is, “How about having a Mix & Mingle on a Saturday night”, being some people can’t make it during the week. So, here you go. A nice laid back setting to meet and talk to people the way it’s meant to be on a Saturday night.

Ichiro is located right on the Main Strip in White Plains.


Sleekly designed Asian fusion restaurants with a beautiful large lounge area!



AND FEEL FREE TO INVITE FRIENDS.


And as always, please take care of the wait staff, thanks.

THERE ARE MANY MORE MEMBERS COMING FROM OTHER GROUPS, HERE'S ONE  OF THEM........  http://www.meetup.com/Sexy-Singles-Going-Wild/events/230376837/



Looking forward to seeing everyone!

Bob
results.how_to_find_us: You'll see me as you enter.
results.name: ~COCKTAILS & CONVERSATION on a SATURDAY NIGHT @ ICHIRO in WHITE PLAINS~

results.description:
It's time again for one of our most popular Meetups! As seen on ABC News, a Nuts & Bolts Mixer is a unique, slightly sexy & great way to meet upscale, outgoing & friendly singles!

Don't "screw" yourself out of the chance to find your right "fit". You'd be "nuts" not to attend. P.S. No "tools" allowed :) 

Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/nutsboltsparty/dates/Apr-23-2016_at_0830PM

Drink Specials & Snacks: 

• 2 For 1 Drinks (8:30-9:30pm)

• FREE Shot for all members birthdays this month

• FREE Snacks for all Meetup members & guests

Ice Breakers:

• You will either receive a nut or a bolt

• The object is to find the nut that fits the bolt

• Return matching hardware to bar & receive a FREE shot

Music & Giveaways:

• DJ on lower level spins best dance music 

• VJ on upper level plays videos at conversational level

• FREE Giveaways & Prizes for Meetup members 

Admission:

$10 first 10 tix w/ discount code "NUTS" at checkout 

Get tix here -https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/nutsboltsparty/dates/Apr-23-2016_at_0830PM

$15 online after that, $20 at the door w/ RSVP, $25 w/o   

Is this venue private for Meetup? Yes. The entire venue will be 100% private for our members and their guests. 

Is this age or ethnic specific? No. This is not an age or ethnic specific event. We get a good mix and a wide range of ages.  

Can I come alone? Yes.  Most come on their own. You can come alone or bring friends - either way you will have a great time. 

How many people will attend? We are partnering with other Meetup groups so the RSVP's shown here are only a small portion of the members attending.  We'll expect 200+ member to attend as in our past Nuts & Bolts Meetup Mixers.
results.how_to_find_us: Party is private for members and their guests - optional name tags will be provided
results.name: Nuts & Bolts Singles Party (2-1 Drinks, Icebreakers, DJ, VJ, Giveaways & More!)

If you haven't been, you owe it to yourself to check it out.

results.description:
We have a full field permit at 9:00 pm at Pier 40 through June 18, 2016. We are looking to grow and develop the sport, so we need players, and bring friends! If we can build this to a sustaining level we'll extend it into the summer and fall. Show off your skills or learn some new ones, and have a great run!!


We are planning a full field game so we need at least enough people to field two teams.  D-poles are welcome and if you know any goalies bring them along. Try to arrive 15 minutes early so we can go live at 9:00 PM!!!  See you Saturday!
results.name: Men's Lacrosse Open Play @ Pier 40

results.description: On April 23rd, 2016 we go #backtopure as #puretrance strips down what clubbing really is about: The Music. We take it back to the essence, to the first raves and dance happenings in abandoned factories and warehouses. Back to the roots of trance music in the early 90’s, when clubbing wasn’t about entertainment or show, but purely based on that special spark that music ignites. Full event page and tickets link: http://www.wantickets.com/Events/200645/Pure-Trance-Solarstone-Giuseppe-J00F-Standerwick-Gai-Barone/?fromDirId=2509&affCode=537e30f0d966401d9a24 Prices at Tier 3 now.
results.name: Pure Trance: Solarstone, Giuseppe, J00F, Standerwick, Gai Barone

results.description:
Hi Everyone,

Join us for fun and competition... RSVP NOW! Limited spots available.

We are going INDOORS in Brooklyn for SATURDAY NIGHTS

9:00 PM- 10:00 PM (1 hour Group Drill for BEGINNER/INTERMEDIATE) COST $25 p.p.; 10:00 PM - 11:00 PM (followed by 1 hour match play) $15:  Total Cost $40

(HIGH INTERMEDIATE/ADVANCED) Cost:  $30 p.p. includes two hours of indoor tennis with same level players, balls, water & light food.

(BEGinner, INTermediate, ADVanced players are grouped in their designated categories)

Please note there is very limited space available...   

MUST RSVP NOW and specify Group drill & match play OR Match Play Only.

PLEASE ARRIVE AT 8:55 PM.

Please note that NY Social Tennis is here to provide fun & competition, please feel free to contact us with your thoughts, concerns, or preference. 

What to Expect... (Warm-up, hitting/drill before placement into levels to play; please feel free to specify if you have a preference... (singles, doubles, mixed).  We will do our best to accommodate!

Look forward to meeting and playing tennis... LET'S HAVE SOME FUN & COMPETITION!

Thanks,

Lily :)

RSVP...

http://www.meetup.com/nystennismb/events/230439624/

We invite you to join An Exclusive Gathering of Friends and Social Circles for a truly one of a kind, all-out Desi Party like no other, celebrate in dramatic New York style and spoil yourself with modern luxury all at Lexicon.  


A Weekly Desi Party of Exclusivity, Luxury & Debauchery....Bollywood Style 

Few Pics From Our Recent Event : http://on.fb.me/1ItEDAo
Few Pics From Our Recent Event : http://on.fb.me/1LSyuIY
Few Pics From Our Recent Event : http://on.fb.me/1XNCkdh
Few Pics From Our Recent Event : http://on.fb.me/1QkcVHo

DESI SATURDAYS

Presents

BOLLYWOOD BEATS

At New York City’s Mega Nightclub & Lounge
L E X I C O N
226 East 54th Street. NYC 

Special Guest : Featuring Delhi's Finest Dj Amit
Lexicon Resident : Dj Harsh
Dhol Percussions By : RAVI BINDRA

Dress Code: Fashion Forward & Chic
Strictly No T-shirts, No Boots, No sneakers. 
21 & Over - Proper ID Required For Admission

For RSVP : www.DesiSaturdays.com
For VIP Table Reservations : 908 - 425 - 1603

Desi Saturdays is one high society DesiParty. Wow factor everywhere. Beautiful people, beautiful venue, beautiful ambiance, and did we mention beautiful people? High energy, amazing music and a packed house are just some of the traits of what you would expect at this weekly desiparty.

This event is the talk of the town amongst young socialites. It's so exclusive it only takes place on Saturday Nights, and don't even try to dress down, because it is almost impossible to get in, but more importantly you would feel so out of place. So don your best, and you may just be lucky enough to party out on Saturdays Nights at Lexicon!!

results.description:
Join us this weekend for our fun Saturday evening @ Hudson Terrace. This is a very popular party with an amazing crowd.

We will be on the first floor of the venue near the coat check area. 

Feel free to invite your family, friends and colleagues to join us at Hudson Terrace.

Gents reduced all night long- $20. Ladies free before midnight. Doorman's discretion afterwards. (Mention Rory's List to the door person)

There will be a 1 hour open bar from 10- 11pm.

Feel free to come solo. You are guaranteed to meet a fun and diverse group of people.

This event normally attracts people in their 20's, 30's and 40's.

Please get there early to avoid the long lines.

Contact us if you have further questions.

Cheers,

Meetup Organizer,

Rory

[masked]


SATURDAY NITE PARTY @ HUDSON TERRACE WITH 1 HOUR OPEN BAR! FREE ENTRY FOR LADIES!

Date: SATURDAY APRIL 23, 2016

Admission: LADIES FREE BEFORE MIDNIGHT (AFTER MIDNIGHT IS DOORMAN'S DISCRETION.

GENTS REDUCED ALL NIGHT LONG!- $20 (MENTION RORY'S LIST)

Time: 10pm- 4am

Venue: HUDSON TERRACE (621 West 46th Street Between 11th & 12th Ave)

Dress Code: BUSINESS CASUAL

Subway: TAKE A, C, 1, 2, 3, N,R,Q, S  TO 42ND STREET.

Hudson Terrace is a beautiful, lush venue with New York City skyline and Hudson River views. Their chic atmosphere, a mix between a upscale lounge and trendy nightclub, is a great place to relax on the weekend.
results.how_to_find_us: Mention Rory's List to the door person

Dear Friends, 

We are finally back with another super fun night: Sociedad Latina NY 11th Anniversary & Jeanny's 41 Birthday celebration with a Psychedelic Flower Power Retro Night; join us to celebrate 11th years of the coolest Latin & world night in NYC!! 

Get your flowered hippie look to dance the best retro and modern dances!!!

Saturday April 23rd, 2016 from 11pm - 4am 

PSYCHEDELIC FLOWER POWER RETRO NIGHT - 11th ANNIVERSARY & JEANNY'S BIRTHDAY PARTY @ OPIA LOUNGE  130 E. 57th Street & Lexington Ave. 

*Retro Dance Show at 12.30am

*Specials on Cocktails at $8. from 11pm to 12am 

*Exquisite Birthday Cakes

*Party Favors

*Raffle for Dinner Certificates at: 

Opia Lounge http://www.opiarestaurant.com/Pio Pio Peruvian Restaurant https://www.facebook.com/PioPioNYC?fref=ts & Juanita's Cafe Peruvian Sangucheria 

Cover Charge: $15. (cash bar) 

Music by DJ Alex Watanabe, spinning: Oldies, Brazilian, Latin Pop, Cumbias, House, Top 40s, 80s, 90s, Merengue, Salsa and more... 

DRESS CODE: Flowered, Colorful, Hippie, Retro and Psychedelic Outfits is a must. Spread the word, invite all your friends!! 

**Sociedad Latina NY reserves the right to refuse admission to anyone**

results.description: Distance: 15 miles.  Sea Bright, NJ to Red Bank, NJ via Rumson, Little Silver, and Fair Haven.  A moderate-paced walk through Rumson, NJ, which calls itself the borough beautiful, and for good reason, because it is beautiful.  Rumson is one of the wealthiest communities in the United States.  Then through Little Silver and Fair Haven, wealthy communities that border Rumson, then on to Red Bank, a quaint town reminiscent of a town circa 1900.  No drop out points.  Meet:  Port Authority bus station by the commuter statue no later than 7:45 a.m. to get the 8:00 a.m Academy bus to Sea Bright (we take the route 36 bus).  Bus arrives in Sea Bright at 9:31 a.m.  Bus fare:  $17/$8.50 senior, one way; train fare:  $16/$7.35 senior.  Total fares:  $33.00/$15.85 senior.  Important:  bring lunch and water as there is no place to buy lunch.  The r/t fare may be a little high, but the beauty of the scenery is worth it.  Leader:  Bill Wrublewski.  Cell: [masked]-0279.  Email:  [masked].  Nonmembers: $3.
results.name: RUMSON, NJ.

results.description:
Our intermediate level road ride is great for a wide range of ability levels from novice to expert. 

This is a fun, no-drop ride averaging between 15-17 mph over varying terrain. Total ride time will be approximately 2.5 hours. Distance will be between 30-40 miles with[masked] feet of elevation, depending on the chosen route.

Group ride experience is recommended, but not required.

Ride departs at 8am sharp, so please arrive 15-20 minutes early to prepare your equipment. Riders should bring sufficient nutrition and flat repair supplies (tube, pump/CO2, tire levers).
results.name: Intermediate Road Ride With Kevin

results.description:
Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on 173 West 108th street , The entrance gate is located on west 108th street and Manhattan ave.

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the field.

Paul.

results.description:
Distance: 15 miles

Sea Bright, NJ to Red Bank, NJ via Rumson, Little Silver, and Fair Haven.

A moderate-paced walk through Rumson, NJ, which calls itself the borough beautiful, and for good reason, because it is beautiful. Rumson is one of the wealthiest communities in the United States. Then through Little Silver and Fair Haven, wealthy communities that border Rumson, then on to Red Bank, a quaint town reminiscent of a town circa 1900. No drop out points.

Meet: Port Authority bus station by the commuter statue no later than 7:45 a.m. to get the 8:00 a.m. Academy bus to Sea Bright (we take the route 36 bus). Bus arrives in Sea Bright at 9:31 a.m. Fare: Bus fare: $17:00/$8.50 senior, one way; train fare: $16:00/$7:35 senior. Total fares:$33:00/$15:85 senior.

Important: bring lunch and water as there is no place to buy lunch.

The r/t fare may be a little high, but the beauty of the scenery is worth it.

Leader: Bill Wrublewski [masked] 

[masked]

Contact hike leader directly if you have questions about the hike.

Free for Shorewalkers members who have paid the annual membership fee, $3 for non-members, visit www.shorewalkers.org to join. If you are not a paid Shorewalkers member, please pay the hike leader at the beginning of the hike.

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8, no subs. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP opens on Friday at 8:30am and closes at 9pm on Saturday evening.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. 

- Rmbr, it's a early morning game. Therefore, if you can't make it, change your RSVP well BEFORE Saturday 9pm to give enough notice for anyone on the waitlist. Changing your RSVP after 9pm will also mean a 2 weeks ban.

- If you turn up late and the game has already started with 16 players, then you won't play.

Absolutely no exceptions to these rules.


PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.

results.description:
NEW CLASS STARTS TODAY

http://1877scubausa.com/images/pop

Check out the Pay One Price Option

This is pool session one for new students starting their diving course.

Your Journey to Adventure starts today. After a brief presentation we will gear up and get started in the pool.

If you have not yet enrolled, please contact the Dive Center to get started [masked]

RSVP required

New Students, If this is your first pool session, you must: 
1. Complete the required academics before the pool session;

Online Students must complete Chapters 1 -6

CD Rom students must complete Sections 1-5

2. Bring a bathing suit and a towel. There are lockers in the changing room so bring a lock if you like.

3. Drink plenty of water before class

4. Don't forget to print out and bring your skills checklist.

5. Print out a copy of the Hand Signals to review and bring with you.

6. If you have not yet completed a "Student Folder" at the store.  Please print out, complete and bring the following three forms to the pool;

1. SDI General Liability Waiver Fill in ALL the blanks:

"Instructors": Kelley Scharf, Andre R.

"Facility": 1-877-SCUBA-USA",

"Agency" : SDI" 

Others": Pablo M. Jay K.

Sign and date at bottom

2. SDI Medical Info Waiver "Instructor": F. Ventura,  "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA ,"City of" Paramus "state of" N.J.

3. Student Information Form</a>

If you have answered YES to any of the medical question; Please print out and have your MD complete the following <a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/SDI_Physician_Sign_Off_2013.pdf">Physician Sign-Off Form

What equipment is required?

A mask, snorkel, fins and a weight belt suitable for SCUBA* and dive boots. A wetsuit is optional and recommended. We have special pricing for our students. Let us know when you would like to come in to be fitted for your student equipment package. Most important is that you will get the "Right Gear, the Right Fit at the Right Price" *Note: Snorkeling equipment is not always suitable for SCUBA activities.

Please arrive on time, late arrivals are subject to rescheduling and fees.

If you have any questions please email or call the shop

Using Dive Computers; To help familiarize you with how they work go to: Why it's a good idea for Divers to own their own SCUBA gear?

RSVP Now

Please RSVP for all pool sessions. RSVPs are required so that we have sufficient staffing for each session. Students who do not RSVP may not get on the roster.No shows are subject to a $29 rescheduling fee.

results.description:
Mother, Son, Father, Daughter.


This Sunday only, any kids 10-14 who bring their parents will save on the Try SCUBA Experience . 

Buy One Get One FREE.

Try It You'll Like It and if you do, sign up and start your lessons the same day. We'll credit your try SCUBA payment towards the class and give.

For anyone who wants to test the waters, this is the Scuba Discovery Program. It gives you a glimpse into what you can expect to see in the underwater world as well as what you could expect to learn in the Scuba Diver Course. You will be shown the basic safety procedures for scuba diving under the watchful eye of an instructor. You will learn skills like equalizing your ears, buddy checks, basic buoyancy control, underwater communication and an introduction to basic scuba equipment and scuba skills followed by an underwater dive in the pool. If you enjoy this experience then the Open Water Scuba Diver course is your next step.

Need more info? Call the Dive Center[masked]

What's Required?

• A curiosity about scuba diving

• A swimsuit and a towel

If you have a mask, snorkel, and fins, bring them.

If not, we'll loan you ours – we will provide everything else!

If all spots are filled get on the waiting list we may run a 2nd session that day

Cost: $25.00 Click to Pay Now!  (Get a $25 credit for your Lessons)

If at the end of the session you are ready to start. You can sign up on the spot and hop right back in.

Just bring a bathing suit and towel and leave everything else to us!

IMPORTANT:

Please print and complete the following three forms to bring to the pool

•  Student Information Form

• SDI General Waiver for all Courses

• SDI Medical Info Waiver

*Physician Sign-Off Form This form MUST BE COMPLETED if the answer to ANY question on the "Medical Info Waiver form is YES before participating

Please note that the entrance to the pool where "Try Scuba" is being held is located in the rear parking lot of the Lodi Boys and Girls Club.

results.description:
Good games last week! We're are playing at Bay 8th Street park. Please don't show up at the wrong park. 


RSVP and show up on time next week!

Thank you.

***************

 
Attendance will be strictly enforced. No-shows will be marked and posted on the subsequent meetup. First time offenders will be given the benefit of doubt, second time offenders will be warned (consider your name in this email and the number of times you no-showed as warning) and those who miss a third time will be banned,permanently! Those that show up without RSVP to circumvent this will be warned as well. We need to know how many people will show up in order to decide if we have enough people for a game that week.

All new members are allowed to play for free the first three games. If you decide to continue with us then please remit the membership fee. Our season starts on 9/1 and the $10 is good for all games for the year.

By attending our games you agree to assume any and all risks involved in these games.

results.description:
Come join us for outdoor tennis at Washington Park in Union City, which is off of the 9th Street light rail station. Bring your sweats, your racquet, plenty of water and balls and we'll see you there! As this event is not designed to match up folks, courts are assigned on first-come first-served basis. So get in early and grab a court.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending.


Although we won't enforce attendance, it would be polite to attend if you commit because others are looking to find others to hit with.

Cross your fingers that it won't rain as inclement weather cancels the meetup.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

results.description:
Hello Walkers... Back By Popular Demand ! The Henry Hudson Trail .... 

This is a Favorite for many of you.

Here's your chance to Capture all the Beauty that Nature has to offer on the Henry Hudson Trail !

So on April 24th  at 9:00am... Come out and join us for this Wonderful Walk... 

Thank you all for coming at least 10 minutes early,,,,

We will Meet in the  Commuter Parking Lot on The Left that you will pass on the way to Sissy's...

This is always a fun walk for all the Newbies to come out and get acquainted with everyone. It has some spectacular views.... Like the one's pictured here...

Believe it or not this is actually a little Park off to the side of the trail. Some even call it the "Secret Garden". We can take a quick peek at it if you wish... It only takes a couple of minutes to do it.

We will be walking in an Easterly Direction till we hit the end of the trail. Take a break for a few minutes, talk about the Great Breakfast we all want to have, and head on back to our starting point. From there, for those who want to join us for coffee & a bite to eat. We'll probably go to Town & Surf Diner which is walking distance from where we parked.  The food is Very Good, and they always take good care of us,,,

Sneakers may be worn but You might want to wear Hiking Boots/Shoes for walking on this trail,,,

As always, we will walk in a LIGHT RAIN and Sunshine

Please Remember to Dress for the Weather !

See you all @ 9:00am. SHARP !

Only A Heavy Rain  will Cancel.

This Rarely ever happens !

Those who RSVPed will be notified by e-mail of any Cancellation.

If you have any doubts, Please check your E-mail.

It will Also be Posted on this Page and Calendar.

• As A Friendly Reminder, Furry and 4 legged friends May Not  join us. Thank you for understanding.

• Please Update your RSVP's as needed,,, The Group and the Organizers Thank you ;~)

results.description:
Let's head out for a MidPackers Long, Slow Distance (MPLSD) Run. We will start and finish at the Starbucks on Queens Blvd and 46th Street.


Details:
9:00am, Starbucks in Sunnyside. There will be TWO pace groups! One at an 8:30/9:00 minute-per-mile, and one at 10:00/10:30 minutes-per-mile.

Watch the comments section for details about this week's MPLSD, including route, total distance and any other specifics that you'll need to know. Please make sure you are able to run the posted distance, and familiarize yourself with the posted route map. This is for your safety and to help keep the group moving at a consistent pace. It's a good idea to bring your Metrocard and some cash in case you need to cut the run short.

IMPORTANT: It's winter, so the water fountains are turned off in all City Parks. Be sure to bring along any fluids and/or nutrition you may need to successfully complete this distance as we'd like to make minimal stops. This is for your health, safety, and comfort.

- - - - - -

connect with us on Google+

like us on Facebook

and follow us on Instagram 
https://instagram.com/woodsidesunnysiderunners/

Two free trial sessions are available for newcomers; membership and playing fees are due for everyone else ($175 for full year, all included; membership year begins May 15). See (2015) Club and Facility Fees info for seasonal and per-session options. ACA Membership is required and due separately from club and facility fees (one-time ACA event membership is included for those in free trial sessions). Regulars: please confirm that your ACA membership is up to date or renew now. NYKP Members receive a discount! Newcomers can join ACA for 6 months at $15 for or for full year $30 (use PAC Individuals & Families options and select New York Kayak Polo).

ATTENTION! ATTENTION! ATTENTION!

Due to recent complications at white plains high school, we will be using a different venue until further notice!

This new field is turf so please bring turf shoes if possible.

Bring a white shirt and colored shirt to help with forming teams easily.

results.description:
LEADER: Peggy Wissler ([masked] (c)[masked])

RATING: B 8/9 B

CHALLENGING HIKE - NO BEGINNERS!  Meet at 9:00 AM at NY/NJ Trail Conference Schoolhouse parking lot and hike a piece of the AT near Warwick, NY. Enjoy early spring foliage. Trip will include car shuttle. TC AT map.

Note that this hike is part of a larger group, the NJR ADK. Most hikers sign up via our printed schedule (see below) and not through Meetup, so though the number of attendees may appear small, we generally have a group of 10-20 on any given hike.

*   *   *   *   *   *


Our full hike schedule can be viewed on our website at hudsonhikers.org, and some hikes are also posted on our Facebook page.

After attending two hikes/events, please consider joining the North Jersey Ramapo Chapter of the Adirondack Mountain Club to support our outdoor recreation and conservation activities.  Membership comes with a variety of benefits including a 10% discount at Ramsey Outdoor; our annual holiday party and social; special events such as our traditional day-outing to the Mohonk Mountain House; a subscription to ADK’s bi-monthly magazine, Adirondac; and the opportunity to contribute to the preservation and extension of hiking lands and viewsheds in our region.

New hikers are strongly encouraged to select hikes appropriate to their capabilities. North Jersey Ramapo Chapter hikes are rated for pace (A, B or C), mileage, and terrain (A, B or C), with "C" designating easier hikes and "A" more challenging ones. We recommend that new hikers should first try a "C" or short "B" hike before undertaking a more difficult one; otherwise, you may not fully enjoy the hiking experience. If you have any doubts, please contact the hike leader in advance. 

Pace Ratings: 
     A = Fast - 2.5 mph or faster 
     B = Moderate - about 2 mph 
     C = Easy - 1.5 mph or less 

Distance: Noted in miles 

Terrain Ratings:
     A = Strenuous, long/steep climbs and descents, 
             possible rock scrambling
     B = Moderate climbs and descents
     C = Generally flat with little elevation change 

For example, a hike rated “B 7 A” is a moderately paced hike of approximately 7 miles with steep climbs and/or descents and possible rock scrambling. 

If you join us for a hike, please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness, including ensuring that the hike is appropriate for your level of fitness, that you wear the proper clothing, and bring the proper gear, food and water (see the ADK's recommended Hiking Essentials and guidelines, below).

Leaders have the right, responsibility and sole discretion to refuse any hiker he/she deems to be not properly attired, prepared, or otherwise fit to safely complete the hike. 

HIKERS' GUIDELINES:

  Risks:  As with all physical activities, hiking involves hazards. Persons participate at their own risk and will be asked to sign a statement acknowledging that fact before starting the hike. Prior to the hike please advise the leader of any medical condition or physical impairment that could affect you during the hike.

  Footwear and Clothing:  Wear clothing suited to the weather and carry extra garments for unexpected weather conditions. Dress in thin layers so that you can adjust the number of layers as required to maintain comfort. In winter carry a wool cap and wool or polypropylene gloves or mitts and a windproof shell. Be prepared for rain. Bring a rain jacket and rain pants, preferably of the type that permits venting body moisture. Wear comfortable, sturdy boots/shoes.  Do not wear cotton garments in winter.

  Drink and Food:  Adequate hydration is important year round. Drink frequently during the hike. Carry food to enjoy during the midday lunch stop.

  Other responsibilities:  Hikers with children under 16 and new hikers are required to contact the hike leader in advance to determine if the hike is suitable for them.  Minors under 16 are welcome on day hikes when accompanied by a parent or guardian.  No person under 18 shall participate in overnight outings unless accompanied by a parent or adult sponsor over 21.  The hike leader may refuse to allow a person to hike who is judged to be poorly equipped or unable to do the published hike.  Participants should get to the hike at least 10 minutes prior to the starting time.

  Maps:  The TC number indicates a NY-NJ Trail Conference map for the area of the hike. For example: TC-118 refers to the Southern Harriman Park map.

  Abbreviations:  NCA-No Calls After . . . , Pref.- Leader’s contact preference.

  Expense Sharing:  When car-pooling, passengers are expected to offer the driver funds sufficient to cover the cost of fuel, tolls and parking fees. A $3.00 minimum per person is recommended. Most hike trailhead meeting locations can be found on NY-NJ Trail Conference maps.

  Dog-Friendly Hikes:  Pets are not permitted on hikes unless the hike description clearly states that it is "dog friendly."  If it is, all hikers with dogs must abide by park leash regulations.

NO SHOW/LATE CANCELLATION POLICY:
Please be considerate of event hosts/organizers and others who may want to attend an event by not being a "NO SHOW" (failing to show up when you've RSVP'd "yes") or a "LATE CANCEL" (changing RSVP to a "no" within 24 hours of an event).  If you have a history of No Shows and/or Late Cancels, we may have to bump you to the waiting list for meetups with limited space, in favor of those with a positive attendance history.

results.description:
Flag Football Game at Cunningham Park (196th St and Union Turnpike) in Queens. Come out and join us!

We have cones and flags so all you need is cleats if that is what you prefer. GAMES WILL ALWAYS BE PLAYED REGARDLESS OF THE WEATHER CONDITIONS i.e. rain, snow, cold, mud, ice, storm, hurricane, etc...we never cancel games due to weather...games are fun and competitive, all skill levels are welcome, please contact me if you have any questions.

NOTE: PLEASE RSVP "YES" ONLY IF YOU ARE GOING TO SHOW UP TO THE GAME.  YOU CAN CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF SOMETHING COMES UP (OR IF YOU DON'T WANT TO PLAY IF IT'S TOO COLD/IT'S RAINING/IT'S SNOWING) AND YOU CAN'T MAKE IT.  NO-SHOWS WILL BE REMOVE FROM THE GROUP.  IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE AN ACCURATE HEAD COUNT SO WE KNOW HOW MANY PEOPLE ARE REALLY COMING.

ere are some of the new changes we have made and a reminder of some of the guidelines we already have:

1) You can not add  guests to your RSVP.  Anyone is free to come and play IF AND ONLY IF you have a profile in meetup and have joined our group.  It's 100% FREE to join and it only takes about 2 minutes to sign up and RSVP.  There are also FREE mobile apps for iPhones and Android phones so you can RSVP easily on the go.  If any of your friends has been playing and wants to continue to play, ask them to go to http://www.meetup.com/Cunningham-Park-Football/ and sign up and RSVP individually.  YOU CAN NOT PLAY if you're not signed up and RSVPd.

2) The first 20 people that RSVP for the game, will play a 9-on-9 game with 1 sub.  Everyone on the waiting list will pick players and play against the winner of the game.  Games will be to 2 scores.  If a team gets 2 scores, with the score 2-1, the other team gets one (1) more possession to try to score and tie the game.  If the game is tied again, the game is now to 3 points and the same rule applies, once one of the teams gets score #3, the other team gets just one (1) more possession to try to tie the game.  If 20 or less players show up to the game, game can be played to whatever score everyone agrees to.

3) If you're one of the first 20 to RSVP, but you're late, the next person on the waiting list that's present on the field will take your place and play in the first game.

4) On a safety, ball stays at the goal line and the next down will be played.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and a safety occurs, the ball stays at the goal line and the 3rd down will be played.

5) On an OBVIOUS "Defensive Pass interference", the ball will stay at the line of scrimmage but you reset your plays and start at 1st down again.  For example: If a 3rd down play is ran and a DPI occurs, the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and a 1st down will be played, then 2nd, then 3rd...etc.

6) On an OBVIOUS "Offensive Pass interference", the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and the offensive time will lose a down.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and an OPI occurs, the offensive team will now be on a 4th down situation from the line of scrimmage.

7) As you might have noticed we have had very few injuries (knock on wood) throughout the years.  This is why we wanted to remind you of the following:

-Stiff arming, flag guarding and hand slapping are NOT ALLOWED.

-Blocks from the back are NOT allowed ad they're obviously dangerous and can cause injuries.

-VERY IMPORTANT: If you are the offensive player and have the ball in your hands, you MUST avoid contact and CAN NOT under any circumstances lower your shoulders and try to initiate contact with an defensive player.  This is flag football, if you're looking for a different type of game there are plenty of other places and leagues to play flag or full-contact football.

8) Donations:  I pay the monthly fee for hosting these meetups and never charge anyone.  All we asked for you is to drop at least $1 in the container we have set up for this, all the money is used for equipment, flags, cones, etc.  You can click on "Group Tools > Money" and see where all the money is going.  If we buy anything with that money we record the transaction and upload a picture of the receipt of whatever equipment we bought.  Next thing we want to get are end zone weighted pylons and we want to buy orange rope so we can mark the field faster and more accurately to avoid any arguments about where the first down is or what not.

IMPORTANT: WE ARE ALL ADULTS AND OBVIOUSLY CAN'T FORCE ANYONE TO DO ANYTHING.  WE NEED EVERYONE'S COOPERATION TO FOLLOW THESE SIMPLE GUIDELINES TO KEEP THE GAME FUN AND COMPETITIVE.  IF FOR ANY REASON YOU DISAGREE OR BELIEVE THAT THESE GUIDELINES DO NOT FIT YOUR STYLE OF PLAY OR WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR ON A PICK-UP GAME, YOU'RE WELCOME TO PLAY WITH A DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUP OR IN ANY OTHER PICK-UP GAME...NO HARD FEELINGS.

If you have any suggestions, questions or concerns, please feel free to reach me at[masked] or [masked]

Regards,

Carlos

results.description:
Come on out, Sole Mates, if you haven't joined us yet for this walk, it's one of the best!  Let's meet for a Sunday AM walk at beautiful 1.7-mile walkway around the reservoir.  We will walk around the walkway once, then stop to eat, then walk again (optional)...just a little over 3 miles.  The freshly paved path has a pair of footbridges, nautically themed decorations and lighting, new landscaping, access to hiking trails, and lots of benches and Adirondack chairs for kicking back and enjoying the views across the water walkway around the Orange Reservoir at the South Mountain Reservation Complex.

We will meet directly across the street from the Oakdale Parking Lot, off of Cherry Lane, in West Orange, NJ at 9:30AM SHARP.  We've been doing a really great job of showing up at least 10 minutes before the walk, so let's please try to keep up the good work!

After our walk, let's sit in Clipper Pavillion at the picnic tables near the reservoir and share 'potluck brunch' such as coffee, donuts, bagels and fruit...nothing too fancy. I will ask that you please RSVP with a comment, to let me know what you'd like to bring and share with the group and I am better able to keep track.

This is a great walk for all you "New Sole Mates " to meet everyone and see what a fun group we are.  There are always plenty of people to chat with and make friends along the way and you will definitely be made to feel welcomed :)!

Looking forward to walking together at this **NEW ** walkway and having another great Sunday morning with all of you!  Please feel free to invite a friend or two!

Remember, if you can't join us there is no need to post a comment; we'll just see you next time!

I will start here with the list of breakfast treats members are planning to bring:

Kate:  Hot Water for Tea, Tea Bags, creamers & sugar 

Lynn: orange juice and juice cups

Kathy: Paper plates, cups, napkins, silverware and dunkin donuts

John: Coffee

Harriet: Yogurt and berries

Sami: cornbread


Dee: Croissants and Jams

Geni: Frittata

Sally: Yogurts, berries, nuts and granola

Ceil: Muffins

Carol: Coffee Cake

Barbara:  Hard-boiled eggs

Grace: Fruit Bowl


Lorraine: Bagels and cream cheese

Jeannie G. - oatmeal cranberry nut cookies.

results.description:
Spring continues on and here is our next ride planned for this coming Sunday.

This time we will travel north-east to a famous dirt bike riding place, the Thomaston Dam in CT. The riding season begins in May but our agenda will be to enjoy the vistas once we get there.

Please reserve your spot by RSVPing so that we can plan the pace, find a suitable lunch place that will accommodate our group, and get an estimate of the general skill level of riders on this trip.

Many of you have enjoyed our rides in the past, so we will naturally cover some twisties and enjoy rest stops in scenic locations along our route. Feel free to bring water and snacks for stops away from civilization. We will officially stop for lunch somewhere half way (TBD).

Meet at 9:45 am, leave at 10. The total distance should be under 200 miles. Plan on a 6-hour fun day.

Please gas up before the ride.

See you soon!

PeterD

***** UPDATE *****


--- Rough route ---

Leave our normal spot, take Bronx River, Saw Mill Parkway (for a change), then some back roads to Brewster, NY, where we will stop very briefly for gas. From there we will take more scenic and twisty back roads towards Lynn Deming Park, passing thru Squantz Pond SP. From Lynn Deming, we will head for Thomaston, which will be less than 1 hr away. Just before we get there, we will stop for lunch around Bethlehem, CT.

Our return trip will also feature a scenic attraction, but it’s a secret for now. :-)

--- Alternate meetup location ---

Lynn Deming Park, New Millford, CT 06776. We should be there around between 12...12:30. I will post the latest ETA in Brewster.

--- Safety ---

PLEASE wear your cold weather gear. It will be chilly particularly in the morning. The max temp will only hover around 60. Don't think you can brave the temps. Remember you will be exposed to 60 mph winds all day long. On the plus side, it will be sunny the whole time.

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on 173 West 108th street , The entrance gate is located on west 108th street and Manhattan ave.

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the field.

Paul.

results.description:
Once inside, feel free to go through the museum at your own pace, either on your own or with your fellow MEETUP members.

We'll be seeing - - - 

Van Dyck: The Anatomy of Portraiture


    Above: Sir Anthony van Dyck (1599–1641), Portrait of                     Charles I of England with his wife, Henrietta Maria,                         1632. Oil on canvas, 44.7 inches by 64.2 inches (113.5                     cm. × 163 cm.). The Collection of the Archiepiscopal                       Castle and Gardens, Kromeríž, Czech Republic.


Anthony van Dyck (1599–1641), one of the most celebrated and influential portraitists of all time, enjoyed an international career that took him from his native Flanders to Italy, France, and, ultimately, the court of Charles I in London. Van Dyck’s supremely elegant manner and convincing evocation of a sitter’s inner life — whether real or imagined — made him the favorite portraitist of many of the most powerful and interesting figures of the seventeenth century. This is the most comprehensive exhibition ever organized on Van Dyck’s activity and process as a portraitist and the first major exhibition on the artist to be held in the United States in over twenty years. Through approximately one hundred works, the exhibition explores the astounding versatility and inventiveness of a portrait specialist, the stylistic development of a draftsman and painter, and the efficiency and genius of an artist in action. Lenders include the Palazzo Pitti in Florence, the Kunsthistorisches Museum in Vienna, the British Museum and National Gallery in London, the Prado Museum in Madrid, and major private collectors such as the Duke of Devonshire and the Duke of Buccleuch.

results.name: Free admission - Van Dyck: The Anatomy of Portraiture

results.description:
This an Intermediate hike (Not suitable for those new to hiking)


About the hike:
 Come explore a beautiful and often overlooked park rich with history and varied terrain that is a stone’s throw from Harriman. We will start the hike from the Sterling Forest visitor’s center and follow the mine trail skirting the lake, then up the Yellow trail to connect to the Sterling Ridge trail which will take us to the orange “Bare Rock” trail to Bare Rock our lunch spot which affords 180 degree views of 7mi long Greenwood Lake. Return via a scramble up to the 60 foot fire tower that affords spectacular panoramic views, and then descend the red fire tower trail to the visitors center.


The basics:
Terrain: Several hills with some light rock scrambling
Elevation Gain: 1400 feet
Distance: 13 miles
Trail Time:  at least 6.5


Getting a spot:
 - If you are driving after you RSVP please write a comment indicating from where and the number of passengers you can take.
- We may need drivers to shuttle train passengers (10 min drive) from Sloatsburg Train station to the Sterling Forest Visitors center so let me know how many you can fit for a shuttle.
- Update your RSVP if you can't make it.
- You will see a page of questions as part of your RSVP.
***You must answer these questions. ***


Public transportation meeting Location and return time:
Departing:
9:14 AM NJ TRANSIT [masked] www.njtransit.com ) train from Penn Station arriving Secaucus 9:20 AM. Change to Port Jervis line leaving Secaucus 9:31 AM. Port Jervis line may also be boarded at Hoboken at 9:23 AM.

Arriving:
10:12 AM, Sloatsburg, Rockland County, NY. Meet at Sloatsburg commuter parking lot southwest of the train platform behind Sloatsburg Hardware (Benjamin Moore)

Return Time:
There are two candidate trains returning from Sloatsburg.  We may have train riders back to the Sloatsburg station for the 4:28pm train but I would not rely on this.  It will depend on the pace of the group.  The next train home is 6:45pm 






Car drivers and passengers:


People who are coming by car and are willing to give rides, please write a comment indicating from where and when you are leaving. If you'd like a ride, please contact a driver (and bring $ to chip in for gas and tolls.)

Visitors Center (driving):

From the North: At junction of Routes NY 17 & NY 17A, take NY 17A west 1.4 miles to left on Long Meadow Road (County Route 84). Go 3.5 miles to right on Old Forge Road. Center is one mile on right

.From the South:

After the convergence of I-87N, I-287N and Route 17N near Suffern NY, take I-87N Exit 15A.  At the end of the off-ramp turn left onto NY17 North/Orange Turnpike, travel 1.4 miles.  Take the exit toward Ringwood/Sterling Forest/West Milford which veers off to the right crossing back over Route 17. 

 This becomes County Route 72/Sterling Mine Road.  Be mindful of the speed limit while passing briefly through a residential area. Travel 2.9 miles to a traffic light at the base of a long hill.  Turn right onto County Route 84/Long Meadow Road.  In 3.6 miles turn left onto W. Sterling Lake Road to find your way to the 

Visitor Center’s parking area. GPS<a> [masked], [masked]</a>


Day Hiking Gear:
- hiking boots
- layers of non-cotton clothes
- sunscreen
- 2 liters of water minimum
- Lunch, Snacks and extra food
- Sterling Forest hiking trail map
- Headlamp
- Hiking Poles

Weather:
Check the forecast for Greenwood Lake, New York.

After the Hike:
 - We will likely stop for dinner.
- Upload your pictures and review the hike!

Disclaimer:
 Participation in this event is strictly voluntary and group members assume all risks in connection with events; per Meetup.com's Terms of Service Agreements, organizers and hike/trip leaders are released from any and all forms of liability related to events.  You can read more about our policies in the Pages section.

results.description:
So we ride over a lot of bridges almost all of them connecting Manhattan to other Boroughs, but a few of them not.  This is a fun ride for those who like zipping over bridges, those who like views, those who take pictures and those who just like going up and down (zippers be forewarned that on this ride we will regroup at the end of each bridge so you will have to be patient for any people taking in the views from the bridges)

We’ll meet up at the Foley Square Fountain and from there we will head over the Brooklyn Bridge which will be the first bridge of the day.  Then we more or less go back and forth into and out of Manhattan for the next 40 miles!

We'll be going right by the Bagel Works on 1st Ave (btwn 66th and 67th) so we will grab something to eat for when we get to Randall's Island (or pack your own lunch). The Lunch stop will be about 20 miles into the ride. 

 As in any ride in NYC you can cut out early if you have to and there are plenty of subways if you get too tired to ride on!  This ride will move much slower than the normal ride as folks take in views and we have to deal with traffic and such, so plan on an all day affair with one long break for a late lunch before finishing up the ride. 

Cue Sheets

So many points here this is covered in 2 cue sheets.

Total mileage to cover all the bridges and end up back at Columbus Circle is 40 miles.  

https://goo.gl/xgKt3K 

https://goo.gl/8q11kp

results.description:
Hi there! I started this group last year, and I want to keep it going, as sharing meditation with others is my passion. We'll meet Saturdays and Sundays at 10am under the big shady tree at the Great Hill in Central park (the entrance is Central Park west and 103rd street). Take the path leading into central park, and go left (up the slope) until you get to the clearing at the top of the hill. If it's rainy or bad weather, I won't be there, but if the suns out, you can find me under the hill. I will let the group know ahead of time if I have to cancel in advance. The session starts 10am, running till around 10:45 or 11am. Bring a towel to sit on, and some water to drink. Beginners and experienced meditators welcome. I try to incorporate a range of styles, as different methods suit different people. I practice vipassana (the practice of calm abiding and observing) and qigong (the art of moving the body's energy), which mold quite well together. Look forward to seeing all of you!

This meditation is free. A $5-10 donation is suggested, but not at all necessary.
results.how_to_find_us: At Central Park West and 103rd Street, take the path into Central Park.  Immiditately after entering, turn left and take the stairs up the path leading upwards.  After reaching the clearing at the top of the hill, find us under the big shady tree
results.name: Meditate

results.description:
COME JOIN US FOR A 15-20 MILE MOUNTAIN BIKE RIDE AT MINNEWASKA STATE PARK.

WE WILL START AT THE PETERS KILL PARKING AREA OFF TO THE RIGHT ABOUT 1/2 MILE BEFORE THE MAIN ENTRANCE GATE TO MINNEWASKA.

Our route will cover both Lake Awosting and Lake Minnewaska and will include the Awosting Falls Carriage Road, Lower Awosting Carriage Road, Lake Awosting Carriage Road, Upper Awosting Carriage Road, Millbrook Mountain Carriage Road, Hamilton Point Carriage Road and Castle Point Carriage Road.

Located in Ulster County, NY Minnewaska State Park Preserve is situated on the dramatic Shawangunk Mountain ridge, which rises more than 2,000 feet above sea level and is surrounded by rugged, rocky terrain. The park features numerous waterfalls, three crystalline sky lakes, dense hardwood forests, incising sheer cliffs and ledges opening to beautiful views, clear streams cut into valleys and 35 miles of carriageways on which to bike and simply enjoy.

For more info on the park please visit: http://nysparks.com/parks/127/details.aspx

Distance: Approximately 15-20 miles

Estimated Bike Time: 4-5 hours

Difficulty:  Ambitious Fit Beginner / Intermediate - A good deal of hill climbing on Carriage Roads with Gravel

Current Weather Forecast: Mostly Sunny with a high of 63 degrees

Fee:  Please Note there is an $10. fee to park per carload if you don't have an Empire Passport

MANDATORY GEAR:

• Mountain Bike or Hybrid

• Bicycle Helmet

RECOMMENDED GEAR:

• Clear eye Protection (safety glasses - for bugs, dirt, etc.)

• Related maps, a compass or GPS, Water, Snacks, First Aid, Sunscreen, bug spray, etc.

• Bike Pump

• Tire Patch Kit and/or Spare Tube

• Warm Layers, Windbreaker, Gloves


PLEASE INSPECT YOUR BIKE PRIOR TO ARRIVAL TO INSURE THE FOLLOWING:

• Proper Tire Inflation

• Lubricated chain

• Properly Shifting gears

• Functional Brakes that don't rub rim or tire when released.

RELATED MAPS:

New York - New Jersey Trail Conference - Shawangunk Trails Map Set

(Specifically Trail Map 104)


BIKE RENTALS ARE AVAILABLE FROM:

http://www.bicycledepot.com/rentals
Contact and Hours

New Paltz, NY 12561

AFTER THE HIKE FEEL FREE TO JOIN US FOR FOOD AND DRINKS AT THE EGG'S NEST RESTAURANT (CASH ONLY - ATM ON SITE) **Venue subject to change based on group interest**

1300 State Rte 213

High Falls, New York

Open 11:30 AM ~ Serving Lunch & Dinner Daily

http://theeggsnest.com/

The Eggs Nest, located in High Falls, NY also fondly known as the “Center of the Universe”, is an Ulster County institution. It is owned and operated by the all around artist Richard Murphy who describes the Eggs Nest as “a living canvas.”  For 40 years it has and continues to be a focal point for the community–a place where good friends meet, be it old-time friends or those we just haven’t met yet. Let our friendly staff meet you at the door and welcome you into our restaurant, a feast for the eyes and a feast for the belly. Enjoy our reasonably priced eclectic menu which features southwestern dishes as well as hamburgers, deli sandwiches, soups and quiche du jour, and a wide selection of Eggs Nest specialties, delights, vegetarian dishes, and nightly specials. Top off your meal with an ample dessert from the menu that features something for everyone. Our hope is that you will be totally satisfied and become part of the Eggs Nest family returning again and again.

results.description:
Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on 173 West 108th street , The entrance gate is located on west 108th street and Manhattan ave.

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed! 

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the field.

Paul.

results.description:
Welcome to TAP New York!

New York's Largest Craft Beer Festival

100+ Breweries |  300 + Beers

Sunday 4/24/[masked]pm

Tickets on sale soon

 

TAPSM New York started out 15 years ago with a couple hundred beer fanatics and a handful of craft brewers at the Culinary Institute of America in Hyde Park, and has grown into the longest running craft beer and food event in New York State.

TAPSM New York has grown over tenfold through the years to now encompass the entire Base Lodge facilities at Hunter Mountain, plus added tent space. Over 90 invited breweries representing over 300 individual beers offer everything from IPAs and lagers to wiesbiers, doppel and trippel bocks, stouts, ales... pretty much any variety you know of, and probably a few that you don't.

Craft brewing is alive and growing in New York State. The resurgance of craft brewing, spawned in part by the creative brewers at Saranac and Boston Brewing, has lead to fuller bodied, flavorful brews featuring rich colors, bold flavors, and imaginative ingredients. New craft breweries are opening every year, and we're both happy and proud to welcome them aboard.

TAPSM New York is also about food. Each year we offer plenty to eat.

TAPSM is also a beer competition. Brewers from across the state enter their finest suds to compete for plaques and trophies. Each year on Saturday at TAPSM, highly qualified judges choose the best craft brewery in New York State and also the best brewery in the Hudson Valley. On Sunday, the panel of judges decide the best indiviual beers in both the Hudson Valley and the entire state.
results.name: 2016 HVH TAKEOVER: Tap NY Beer Fest!  Hunter Mountain - Never too early to plan!

results.description:
This run will be beginner-friendly, but we welcome runners at all levels. We will be running anywhere from 2 - 6ish miles depending on what everyone is looking to do. 

The main starting point will be at Columbus Circle by the gold statue (not the silver unisphere).

Here are some options:

Advanced: 
6 miles: Lots of hills. Run along the full outer loop of the park. The hills are more challenging if you run counter-clockwise. 

Intermediate: 
~5 miles: Run along the outer loop but cut across the 102nd st traverse.  You'll skip the infamous Harlem hill.

Beginner: 
1.7 miles: Run around the lower loop. Cut across the 72st traverse and hang a left again once you hit the west side, end back at Columbus Circle.

If possible we will break into pace groups, but either way lets meet back at the USS Maine Monument around 12-12:15am.

Where do I leave my stuff? 
The New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center (located on the 2nd floor) has open bins, and lockers behind the cash register. To use the lockers, you must bring your own lock. They also have changing rooms. These services are free. The New York Running Company opens at 11am on Sunday. 

What time does the run actually start?
Plan on arriving at 11am, but we won't start running until about 11:15am in case people need to change or drop off their stuff at the NY Running Company. We will not wait longer that 11:15am.  

What happens after the run?
After the run once everyone is together again, we can grab some food! Weather permitting, we can get something to eat from Whole Foods (or wherever you like), and we can sit and eat in the park. We can walk over to the Sheep Meadow.
If the weather is not picnic-friendly, we can hit our goto place which is Cosmic Diner on 52nd and 8th ave. Hot chocolate, coffee, pancakes? Mmmm.. If anyone wants to suggest a different place that is close by, we're flexible.


Call/text Henry at (646)[masked] if you have any questions or are having trouble finding us.

Dig deep and drag yourself out to go for a run! You'll be glad you did!

** only RSVP 'No' if you were previously a 'Yes'.

results.description:
BUILD YOUR BRAND WITH SOCIAL MEDIA

Have you ever wondered how that person got so many Instagram followers? 

Do you find yourself struggling what you should post for each social media platform?

Do you need help developing a successful social media strategy for your brand?

Do you want to sell more of your products/services through social media but don’t know how?

If you answered yes to any of the above-you need to take this workshop!

We all know that Social media is here to stay! It has become a key tool in helping businesses build their brands, develop customer loyalty and ultimately attract new customers. 

For creative entrepreneurs, fashion bloggers, professionals and students it can be overwhelming to stay on top of the latest trends and develop an effective social media strategy.

No excuses! It has to be done!

Social Media maven KimberlyKong of Sensible Stylista

(over 60K followers on Instagram @sensiblestylista) will join us and show you how can you can create a strong online presence with the holy trinity of social media platforms: Facebook, Instagram and Twitter.

Here's just a few of the topics we'll cover:

·  How-to get new followers on each platform

·  Create a cohesive and effective account on each platform.

·  Engage your existing audience and drive sales.

·  Manage your content and "recycle" material.

AND MUCH MORE!

We'll also hold a 30 min Q&A session at the end of our workshop to cover any questions you might have!

Whether you’re an emerging designer, new to the fashion business, or a fashion student thinking of launching your own label, this workshop will give you the practical insight into what to do and what not to do in order to successfully create a social media strategy!


Come join us!

She has been featured in substantial publications like InStyle and Lucky Magazine and has made TV appearances as both model and host.  In addition to blogging full-time, Kimberly is a Juilliard-trained concert pianist/teacher by day and is currently pursuing her Doctorate in Piano Performance.
