results.description:
The Gauguin Connection - Estelle Ryan


As an insurance investigator and world renowned expert in nonverbal communication, Dr Genevieve Lenard faces the daily challenge of living a successful, independent life. Particularly because she has to deal with her high functioning Autism. Nothing - not her studies, her high IQ or her astounding analytical skills - prepared her for the changes about to take place in her life. It started as a favour to help her boss' acerbic friend look into the murder of a young artist, but soon it proves to be far more complex. Forced out of her predictable routines, safe environment and limited social interaction, Genevieve is thrown into exploring the meaning of friendship, expanding her social definitions, and for the first time in her life be part of a team in a race to stop more artists from being murdered.
results.name: Let's Discuss The Gauguin Connection by Estelle Ryan

Feel free to stop by even if you don't have a project to show. For artist who know very little about graphic design, feel free stop by to say hello.

15 minutes: Icebreakers. A go around of who you are and what you hope to gain from the group.

45 minutes. pretty much what your working on. Small examples more of a segway into discussion. After which questions and advice. Even a bit of help for those who need it.


Please RSVP for the meetup if your going. There's nothing more dull than being an organizer expecting people to show up only to have no one show up. Extend the courtesy please. and thanks

A few "caveats" this is a dunkin doughnuts We'll be at the west table. Please be mindful that this is a dunkin doughnuts.


ps. at the end of the month there's a tutorial meetup check it out.


thanks

results.description:
梁彼得的主审法官将于4月份量刑，华人们应该团结起来利用这个最后的机会向法官表示态度，争取让梁彼得案得到最好的结果。

协会已经派代表联系过梁彼得的辩护律师，声援信将由律师一起呈现给法官。

如果希望通过美国华人创业投资协会的帮助了解如何向法官发信，或者加入一起集体发信，请联系电子邮件[masked],协会将提供标准的支持信格式以及发送的地址。

Letter Sample:

[Name & Address]

____________________________________________

____________________________________________

_________________, 2016

Chambers of the Honorable Danny Chun

Supreme Court of the State of New York

County of Kings

320 Jay Street, 19th Floor

Brooklyn, New York 11201

  RE:  People v. Peter Liang

Indictment No. 9988/2014

Dear Honorable Chun,

  I am writing to you in support of Police Officer Peter Liang. I believe that his conviction was unjust and I do not believe that the charge of reckless manslaughter is supported by any reasonable view of the evidence submitted at trial. Likewise, the conviction of official misconduct is unsupported by the evidence.

I respectfully ask that you set aside the illogical verdict handed down by the jury. If you will not set aside the verdict, I respectfully ask that you sentence Police Officer Peter Liang to probation. Institutional confinement of Police Officer Peter Liang is not necessary for the protection of the public. A prison sentence would be inconsistent with the ends of justice.

Respectfully submitted,


Instruction 

SUPPORT PETER LIANG - SAMPLE SUPPORT LETTER TO JUDGE DANNY CHUN

If you would like to support Peter Liang, please write a letter to the Judge expressing your feelings about the trial and verdict. Liang’s lawyer Robert E.Brown has included a SAMPLE letter below, but you don't have to use it. If you have the time, you can choose to write a letter in your own words.


Send the letter to Attorney Brown (and not the Judge directly) so he can include it in a court filing.

Email it to: [masked] or fax it to[masked] or mail it to:

Robert E. Brown, PC 
44 Wall Street, 12th Floor

New York, NY 10005

The Vegans are coming! 

The Vegans are coming!

The vegans are taking over everything! They're replacing hamburgers with Veggie Burgers.. Fries with Kale, Ice Cream with VEGAN Ice CREAM!! 
They even took your favorite bar and turned it into a vegan restaurant.. NOOO!!!

But like the old adage goes, when you can't beat them... DO A COMEDY SHOW in their RESTAURANT, and we've chosen the best vegan restaurant in town to do it, The VSPOT on ST MARKS!!

This FREE COMEDY SHOW features some of the best comedic talent in NYC, AND a full Latin-Vegan food menu and drink specials!

Check out their menu: http://www.vspotstmarks.com/

PLUS!! 
** A special Sunday RAMEN MENU w. Scallion Pancakes by Chef Junie Ishimori 

Drink Specials include: 
- $3 Brooklyn Beers 
- $3 Lemon Drop Soku Shots 
- Half-off bottles of wine

Seating is limited and by reservation only.  To Reserve a seat, RSVP through Eventbrite w. your best email and show your confirmation at the door.

Come end the weekend with some laughs!!

results.description: Sophie's Choice is a 1979 novel by American author William Styron. It concerns the relation between three people sharing a boarding house in Brooklyn: Stingo, a young aspiring writer from the South who befriends the Jewish Nathan Landau and his beautiful lover Sophie, a Polish survivor of the German Nazi concentration camps. The plot ultimately centers on a tragic decision which Sophie was forced to make upon entering the concentration camp.

Come and receive - spiritual nourishment and an opportunity to relax and rejuvenate - in the physical and every other sense. We've had some amazing gatherings Sunday after Sunday - sunshine for the soul through each and every one's Light - their presence and spiritual participation. This is what make Neolyth such a well of positive atmosphere - community gatherings of kindred spirits. We are 'spiritual beings having a human experience' and every one has unique gifts to offer from and through their Soul.

These gatherings will now provide a space to lie down in Savasana or relaxation pose while listening to live sound of alchemical crystal bowls, guided imagery, and spiritually oriented ancient verse and poetry. The door will remain open for you to come in quietly and find a comfortable mat and seat. Small donations appreciated!
results.name: Sunday Night Meditation with Crystal Bowls

results.description:
Travelogue is tomorrow, y'all!!! Hope to see you there!!! 

WE TELL STORIES (and drink sangria specials!) at this FREE event at New World Stages!!!! In addition to hearing from a handful of curated special guest writers/performers at each event, this is also an opportunity for you to tell a story from your travels off the cuff or to bring in a prepared essay, journal entry, blog, video, poem, song, or even a piece of fiction that you created about/while traveling--domestically, internationally, or even from one side of the city to the other! (At least two-three story-tellers will be pulled from a hat so, if you're interested, be sure to drop your name in when our host passes it around!)

Even if you don't share a story, come listen, reunite, and hug us!!!! It's been too long! If we've never met, then it's REALLY been too long; introduce yourself!

Hosts:
   Mike Axelrod
   Lacy Allen

Featured Performers/Writers:

     Amna Dolphin
     Misian Taylor
     Karina Valez
     Amber Godfrey
     Lilia Rusu/Anna Cherkezishvili
     Mary K. Baxter


WHAT SHOULD I EXPECT?

Travelogue is a free event -- hosted by the lovely Mike Axelrod and Lacy Allen--filled with creative travelers, supportive friends, and fun performances. All Travelogue storytellers will receive a free T-shirt in appreciation for sharing.

DID WE MENTION THAT THE EVENT IS FREE AND THAT THERE ARE DRINK SPECIALS! WHEN AND WHERE?

Sunday 4/24 7:15-9:30 New World Stages, downstairs in the Time Out New York Lounge. (340 West 50th St.) QUESTIONS?

Visit www.dramaticadventure.com
and/or:
Email [masked]
results.name: Free Storytelling Event!  Travelogue is TOMORROW!

results.description: We meet every Sunday night from 7:30-8:45 pm at South Mountain Yoga. We do a 20 minute guided meditation (usually one of Thich Nhat Hanh's), walking meditation, and a 20 minute silent sitting. Jean also picks a reading. At the end, there is time for sharing (optional) as a way to practicing listening and speaking about issues of mindfulness in our week, sittings, and daily lives. No experience is necessary.  There is a suggested donation of $10. Please try to arrive on time and refrain from wearing fragrances.  Cushions and folding chairs are available or you can bring your own. Please note: many sangha members attend the group without responding here on meetup.
results.how_to_find_us: Next to the Chase Bank; next to the sound garden. One flight walk up to 2nd Floor. Parking on street or in parking lot behing the buiding. No meters on Sunday.

results.description:
Celebrate this crazy Election Year with “This Machine”

An evening of original songs and laughter with Roy Zimmerman

Without a doubt, Roy Zimmerman is one of the most important political commentators of the last few decades. With music this good and humor this insightful, there is good reason to be optimistic!


"Roy's lyrics go beyond poetry and achieve perfection."  Joni Mitchell

Entry - $18 (or what you can pay)

The title “This Machine” is Roy’s nod to Pete Seeger and Woody Guthrie—an acknowledgement that songwriting can do good work in the world.  Roy Zimmerman write hilarious, rhyme-intensive songs that also turn the world inside out and upside down!  “Sometimes I think satire is the most hopeful and heartfelt form of expression,” Roy says, “because in calling out the world’s absurdities and laughing in their face, I’m affirming the real possibility of change.”
Roy has recently shared the stage with Bill Maher, John Oliver, Ellen DeGeneres, and Kate Clinton.  His songs have popped up on HBO and Showtime.  He’s been profiled on NPR.  And he’s a featured blogger on The Huffington Post.
results.name: CONCERT!  An evening of original songs and laughter with Roy Zimmerman

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.

"FORGIVENESS BRINGS INNER JOY AND PEACE"

"I have the power to heal myself. You have the power to heal yourself. 

                    Together we have the power to heal the world."

These words awakened and inspired me.  They have greatly empowered my own understanding of what is possible and created miracles in my life and my loved ones experiences.

Now its your turn.

All conflict, disease, discomfort, resentments and misunderstandings exist only because of soul, mind and body blockages. But how can we heal the invisible? Give it love. Give it love. Give it love. My teacher Dr. and Master Sha teaches that "Love melts all blockages and transforms all life".

Forgiveness and Love are partners and hold the same power.

That is why I am inspired to share this valuable resource with you.

Everyday we gather with like minded persons to connect heart to heart, soul to soul to partake in a forgiveness practice to transform all areas of our lives. Dr Sha teaches that "the purpose of life is to serve".  

I know everyone's heart is yearning to serve but how can you serve fully when your heart is broken and hurting, when your mind is fractured, your body is afflicted, your finances are meager and relationships are draining every ounce of energy you have?

So join us at 6 am EST Mon-Fri only at [masked] with access Code[masked]#.

This call is for new and experienced spiritual seekers. All traditions are welcomed.

I am honored to serve you.

Study hard consistently, challenge yourself and use the language daily. That's how you'll get fluent in your target language. I study languages every day from six in the morning. Can you keep up? It'll make you fluent!

This one workout will keep you amped up all week long. Seriously, give it a try and you will be hooked!


The exercises may change from week to week, but it is always a Tabata-style interval workout: 20 seconds of high intensity work followed by 10 seconds of rest. Then repeat! Exercises include sprints, burpees, squats, situps, box jumps, step ups, pushups, dips, and other “no-frills” exercises.

Every week we will have a different prompt for our weekly photo project.  This week’s theme is Furry friends

Each week beginning early Monday morning, you can begin uploading your photos to our meetup album for the week’s theme.  The group won’t actually meet for this event, it’s an individual online challenge for each of you to get your creative juices flowing, share photos in the group, comment and critique each other’s shots, and above all have fun. 

Albums will remain open, so you can upload photos any time after that Monday morning start time but you’ll get the most feedback during the initial week the theme is posted.  You also don’t have to restrict yourself to photos taken during that week for the theme, they can be from past shoots you have done or the weekly prompt can be used to motivate you to shoot something new.

Please consider sharing your project photos with our other chapters on our Facebook group.

results.description:
Did you ever daydream about pouring a slab of reinforced concrete? Here's your chance!

We need a solid foundation to support the rebuilt oven, fireplace, and hearth at the Old Stone House.

Eagle Scout candidate Andrew Sapini will lead community volunteers (that's you!) and Boy Scouts from local Troop 310 in digging a hole, framing it with timber, mixing and pouring concrete, and all kinds of disassembling the current oven.

Bring your own work gloves, wear boots, and prepare to have fun with cement, rebar, and trowels. Everyone who participates today will be named on the dedication plaque as a "Friend of the Oven"!

Refreshing drinks and safety equipment will be provided.

(Boots or heavy shoes are recommended.)
results.name: Oven Reconstruction: Pour the Foundation Slab

results.description:
THIS IS A PRE-PAID EVENT, NO LATE REGISTRATIONS ON-SITE ALLOWED

BUY TICKETS HERE:  http://www.cototravel.com/startuptournyc-1/

Are you an entrepreneur, freelancer or student interested in learning more about the tech & startup scene in NYC?  

Great!  But where do you start?

Join us on our inaugural Startup Tour NYC on Monday, April 25th as we formally introduce you to the NYC tech scene and startup ecosystem.  You will connect with fellow startups & technologists, meet “movers and shakers” in the NYC community, explore different resources and networks that can help your business or career and listen to great leaders in the space talk about their experiences building their ventures in New York.  As a bonus, you'll also meet & interact with members of the Philadelphia startup community visiting NYC that same day.

Our goal is to help each attendee learn how to navigate and work with NYC startup & business community now and in the future.

Who is this for?

Founders and startup teams involved with early to growth stage venturesLocal mentors, technologists and press interested in exploring connections to the NYC startup sceneStudents interested in starting or working for a startup

What's the agenda?

• Afternoon:  Check in at NYU Incubator (137 Varick Street) at 1:15pm

• NYC Meet & Greet Lunch event with members of the NYC and Philadelphia startup communities

• Opportunity to share your current work & needs with a panel of leaders/connectors of the NYC tech/startup community

• Participate in a unique workshop where you'll help a group of startups with their pitch presentations

• Admission to Startup Grind NYC, featuring a Fireside Chat with Morgan Hermand-Waiche

Featured Programs:

1.  Lunch event at NYU Incubator, where the group will meet with a small group of NYC tech & startup community members. Each attendee will have 30 seconds to share their current work & business needs with a panel of leaders in the community (confirmed so far are the folks who run the NYU Incubator ( Mina Salib ), Pavan Bahl (fashion tech entrepreneur), Rob Sanchez (serial entrepreneur & adviser), and James Quick (Tech Evangelist for Microsoft)  for feedback & suggestions.  More to come as they're confirmed.

2.  Pitch workshop at Starta Accelerator, a new program helping Eastern European startups gain traction in the US.  After having the opportunity to receive help from mentors & advisers at the NYU event, our group will help their cohort of startups refine their presentations for investors later that week.  The accelerator is run by serial entrepreneur & marketing authority Katya Dorozhkina

3.  We end the day by attending Startup Grind NYC, with networking opportunities with other members of the NYC startup & business community and a fireside chat with Morgan Hermand-Waiche, founder of tech & lingerie startup Adore Me.
results.name: Startup Tour NYC #1

results.description:
A Prime Position in Midtown Manhattan. The Wyndham Midtown 45 at New York City is a serene, sophisticated oasis in the heart of Manhattan. It is located on 45th Street between 2nd and 3rd Avenues, within walking distance of many of New York City’s major attractions such as Grand Central Station, Central Park and Rockefeller Center, as well as Park, Madison and Fifth Avenues. It offers easy access to Times Square, the Theater District, the SoHo & Tribecca neighborhoods, and Wall Street. There will be extensive walking on this trip, which is the best way to see the City!

Many people in the past have expressed more interest in trips that are less than a week long, so I have reserved four nights in our Presidential suite, that has two bedrooms, a living room, kitchen and dining area. Just Us Girls had a very enjoyable trip to NYC several years ago, and I have had requests to do another trip to New York. Since I am from the area, and visit NYC a few times a year, I will plan some tours and make lunch and dinner restaurant reservations. Some of the places we will be dining are: the Nordic Food Hall at Grand Central (Monday lunch), Le Bernardin (Monday dinner), Caffe Lavazza in Mario Batali's Eataly Market (Tuesday lunch and shopping), Per Se (reservation made for Tuesday dinner), Osteria del Circo (Wednesday dinner), Sirio Ristorante (Thursday dinner), and we will visit Chelsea Market, UrbanSpace Vanderbilt food market on Park Avenue, Tommy Bahama's Restaurant, 500 Park Avenue, and Baldoria, if time allows.

The $800 covers your accommodations, two per room in our suite (women, over 21 only). If you do not want to share a bed, put a +1 where it asks if you are bringing a guest when you RSVP for this Meetup. Plays, tours, meals, transportation, etc., will be additional. In the past we put some extras together with the agreement of everyone who signed up (such as a tour), and then collected that as a separate payment. I am not a travel agent, so you will have to book your own flights and transportation to and from the airport (I fly into LaGuardia). Let me know if you have any questions. I hope you can join us!

Some of the sights we will be seeing:

One World Trade Center

http://admin.guestofaguest.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/09/freedom-tower.jpgStanding as the tallest skyscraper in the Western Hemisphere (a whopping 1,776 feet – the height referencing the year the Declaration of Independence was signed), the $3.9 Billion building represents strength, dignity, and perseverance. Dubbed as the “Freedom Tower,” One World Trade Center opened on November 3, 2014. Not only does it have an observatory; it's also home to big name companies like Condé Nast Publications (Vogue). There is an indoor mall with many restaurants and shops to explore. Where: FiDi, 285 Fulton Street, New York, NY 10007.

The 9/11 Memorial Pools

http://admin.guestofaguest.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/09/memorial-pools.jpgThe 9/11 Memorial Pools are absolutely breathtaking. In a city that is constantly overwhelmed with noise and hustle and bustle, the memorial provides an escape for onlookers, a solemn silence to honor the lives that were lost. The twin memorial pools have the names of every person who died in the terrorist attacks of February 26, 1993 and September 11, 2001. Where: FiDi, 180 Greenwich Street, New York, NY 10007. Open to public daily from 7:30 AM – 9 PM.

The Cloisters

Located within Fort Tryon Park, itself perched on a cliff that overlooks the Hudson River and the George Washington Bridge, the Cloisters is assuredly one of the most beautiful places in New York. Located at the top of the island of Manhattan, the Cloisters is a part of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, so fare at one museum pays for entry to the other, provided the visit is the same day. Built by John D. Rockefeller Jr. in 1917, the Cloisters is a franken-museum, made up of pieces of disparate medieval European monasteries threatened by demolition. The result, however, is strikingly lovely and peaceful.

results.description:
Our twice-monthly meeting of business professionals takes place from 4pm - 5pm in a private meeting room at the restaurant.

While there are many ways to make connections with potential new clients, nothing is better than having that prospect's trusted advisor pick up a phone or send an e-mail that says, "Here's someone you need to speak with about that problem you're having".  This is exactly what the members of Smart Transition Group do for each other.  We get to know each other, we get to trust each other, and then we share our most valuable resource... our clients.  

We all want to grow our businesses, but doing it personally, face-to-face, with people you trust and appreciate, makes it faster, easier, and far more effective.  Come learn more as a guest of the group at one of our upcoming meetings.  Bring your best-self, and a stack of business cards.

We'll take an opportunity to introduce ourselves and get to know other members. We will often have a featured member who will expand on the details of their business and help us to understand their buying signs so that we know who to think of when we hear them from our clients.

After a good discussion and a recap of the progress we will retire to the bar at Morton's for a drink and a more relaxed discussion. Some say, that's where the business really happens.

This is a great way to spend some time on a Monday afternoon growing your network and building alliances.
results.name: Monday Meetings at Morton's (The Steakhouse)

group.name: Smart Transition Group - Business Networking that Works

results.description:
The Licktoad goblins of Brinestump Marsh have stumbled upon a great treasure—fireworks! Yet unfortunately for them, the tribe member responsible for the discovery has already been exiled for the abhorrent crime of writing (which every goblin knows steals words from your head). To remedy this situation, the Licktoads’ leader, His Mighty Girthness Chief Rendwattle Gutwad, has declared that the greatest heroes of the tribe must venture forth to retrieve the rest of the fireworks from a derelict ship stranded in the marsh. In order to prove themselves as the Licktoads’ bravest goblins, the PCs must complete a series of dangerous dares, from swallowing bull slugs and braving the dreaded Earbiter to dancing with Squealy Nord himself. Yet even once they’ve proven their mettle, the adventure is just beginning. For the ship in question is far from uninhabited, and Vorka the cannibal goblin would like nothing better than a few tasty visitors....

We Be Goblins! is an adventure for 1st-level characters in which the PCs play a horde of malicious and murderous goblins. All players with be provided with a pre-generated goblin character so all you need to bring is your lucky dice and sense of adventure. This game will provide Pathfinder Society credit and advance any character you already have or wish to create for PFS games. This is a great introduction to Pathfinder and PFS, and new players are welcome.
results.name: PFS: We Be Goblins!
Soccer meetup

venue.name: Voorhees Theatre, New York City College of Technology

results.description:
Registration begins at 5:30 pm.


Program begins promptly at 6 pm.

MC: Ryan Letts

First Speaker: Mr. Martin Drake

Martin (Marty) A. Drake, Chief, Science and Technology Division & Command Science Advisor, U.S. Central Command. He will be talking about USCENTCOM, its concerns in the USCENTCOM Area of Responsibility (AOR), and the requirements of USCENTCOM.


U.S. Naval Academy graduate with a Bachelor of Science in Systems Engineering and a Master of Arts in National Security and Strategic Studies from the U.S. Naval War College.  Completed the Senior Executive Fellows course at Harvard’s Kennedy School of Government.

Served 28 years in the U.S. Navy as a Surface Warfare Officer in five separate ships; commanding two – USS PEGASUS (PHM-1) and USS THORN (DD988).  Focus while assigned in surface ships was Weapons and Combat Systems.  Held principal staff positions ashore in the U.S. Naval Academy (Instructor), Commander-in-Chief, U.S. Atlantic Fleet (Chief of Exercises), Naval Amphibious School (Deputy Director for Total Quality Leadership), a first tour in Commander, U.S. Central Command (Chief of Exercises; Division Chief, Transformation and Integration; Deputy Director, Resources and Assessment); and Office of the Secretary of Defense (Military Advisor to the Director, Defense Research and Engineering).

Currently employed as the Chief of Science and Technology Division and Command Science Advisor to U.S. Central Command located in Tampa, Florida.  Directs a staff chartered to conduct discovery, research, analysis, and sponsor development of new and emerging technologies and techniques which have the potential to provide solutions to Headquarters and Component validated Joint needs.  Additionally, pursues integrating and non-material solutions to satisfy current and future military operational capability gaps.  Holds a Level III Systems Planning, Research, Development, and Engineering (SPRDE) qualification for Technology Management.  Frequently lectures on technology impacts to the current and future military force. 

Second Speaker: David Rios, SOCOM IAC

Legal Panel:


Join us for a Moderated Legal Panel Discussion with local lawyers about Intellectual Property, Information Security, Risk, Privacy, Cybersecurity and Government at Customer.

Moderator: Mike Dabbene

Panelist: Jonathan Askin, PhD | Brooklyn Law School and BLIP

Jonathan Askin is a professor at Brooklyn Law School, teaching technology, telecommunications, and entrepreneurial law and policy. He is the Founder of the Brooklyn Law Incubator & Policy Clinic (http://www.brooklaw.edu/blip), which represents Internet, new media, communications and other tech entrepreneurs, startups, innovators and organizations on business development, policy advocacy and law reform.  He is also the Faculty Chair and Innovation Catalyst for the Brooklyn Law Center for Urban Business Entrepreneurship. Jonathan has served as a Visiting Professorial Fellow at the Centre for Commercial Law Studies, Queen Mary University of London, a Fellow at the Columbia Institute for Tele-Information, an Adjunct Professor at Columbia Law School, and Founder/Advisor to iLINC, a network of legal support clinics for the European startup community. Jonathan is spending this Spring 2016 as a Visiting Professor at the MIT Media Lab and this Summer as a Fulbright Scholar with the University of Amsterdam. Jonathan chaired the Internet Governance Working Group for the Obama ’08 Presidential Campaign. He has served on the boards of many communications and Internet industry and consumer groups.  Jonathan is an honors grad of both Harvard College and Rutgers Law School.

Panelist: John Bandler, Esq. | Bandler Group

Discussion topic: Cybercrime and data privacy are serious issues that we face today, and those creating new technologies, products, and applications should think about privacy and security by design, rather than something to be added on as the product nears completion.  Cybercriminals are constantly looking at ways to break into systems and applications to steal the data.  And technologies are collecting more and more data about people which needs to be safeguarded and treated according to various laws and regulations.

John Bandler founded a legal and consulting practice to bring his experience to the private sector to help corporations and individuals with cybersecurity, data privacy, investigations, and anti-money laundering.  John has 20 years of government experience, including thirteen as a prosecutor at the New York County District Attorney's Office, where he was hired by the legendary Robert M. Morgenthau. He gained unique insights into cybercrime, cybercrime intelligence, digital currency money laundering, and identity theft, and also prosecuted a wide variety of cases from inception through resolution, ranging from global cybercrime data trafficking and money laundering to violent street crime. Prior to his time as a prosecutor, John served as a State Trooper in the New York State Police for eight years, serving in one of the busiest stations in the state.  He was also a commissioned U.S. Army officer, serving in infantry and military intelligence reserve units. He is licensed to practice law in NY, CT, and DC, and holds various professional certifications in fraud investigation, information security, privacy, anti-money laundering, and information technology, including CISSP, GCIH, GCCC, CIPP/US, CFE, CAMS, Cloud +, Network +, and A +.

Panelist: Nina L. Kaufman, Esq. | Kaufman Law PLLC

Nina Kaufman is a small business champion—not just your ordinary business attorney. Forbes Magazine calls her “One of the 25 Most Influential Women Tweeting about Entrepreneurship.”  The U.S. Small Business Administration named her their regional Women in Business Champion of the Year for her creative approaches to educating and advocating for small businesses.  In over 15 years in business, Kaufman has helped thousands of entrepreneurs in the generation of tens of millions of dollars by working diligently to help her clients save time, money and aggravation with business law issues. As a trusted thought leader, Kaufman reaches over 2 million readers each month on Entrepreneur.com


Panelist: Steven Rubin, Partner | Moritt Hock & Hamroff

Mr. Rubin has 15 years of experience in consulting clients on patent-related matters. He advises clients throughout all phases of a patent’s life from conception by an inventor to enforcement. He drafts and prosecutes patent applications and has managed large international patent portfolios. In addition, Mr. Rubin also identifies potential patent infringement assertions and potential cross-licensing opportunities and provides infringement opinions as needed. In the cybersecurity space, Mr. Rubin relies on his technology background in counseling clients and creating written information security plans (WISPs). Mr. Rubin focuses his practice on technology relating to electronics and computer science and has worked in diverse fields such as software; multi-core architecture; augmented reality; optical communication; information processing; image processing; security systems; videoconferencing; network based technologies, including cloud computing;mobile applications; search engines; military defense systems; physics; material science; encryption; chemical engineering; nanotechnology; medical devices; microlithography; RF-ID; fabrication and production of semiconductor devices; computer and network architecture and monitoring; circuits; coding/decoding, processing and transmission of signals; antennas; cell phone and pager technology; printer and display technology including LCD control; transmission, compression,synchronization, processing, and display of television signals; optical communications and lens technologies; mechanical devices; and lighting circuitry.

Networking Reception: refreshments will be provided

Meetup Mashup Participants:

Technology Transfer Days Meetup:  http://www.meetup.com/Technology-Transfer-Days/

Information Architecture Meetup: http://www.meetup.com/information_architecture/

Semiotics Web Meetup: http://www.meetup.com/SemioticsWeb/

OWASP Brooklyn Meetup: http://www.meetup.com/OWASP-Brooklyn/

Do you require any special accommodations? If so, please let us know: [masked]

Bring a story, a memory, a photo.

results.description:
This is the second of regular happy hours that we will be organizing for government staff workers in the greater New York City area. This includes local, state and federal government workers, along with staff from non-profits, NGOs and international organizations, from junior analysts to directors. We can socialize and network in a casual atmosphere.

We will meet upstairs at The White Horse at 25 Bridge Street in lower Manhattan at 5:30. We will be there to at least 7:30 and possibly later if people want to stay longer.

Panelist: Nina L. Kaufman, Esq. | Kaufman Law PLLC

Government contracting can be a great way to get into the sandbox with the “big players.”  But you need to have your ducks in a row to do it right—without having it take down your business in the process. How does your business model need to adapt, if you’ve been used to working with the private sector? What do you need to understand about your cash flow?  What are the risks of partnering with larger companies, or working as a subcontractor or a project? How can you prove you’re entitled to special minority or women’s business consideration? With careful thought and planning, this route can be a boost to your business!

Bio: Nina L. Kaufman, Esq., is a small business champion—not just your ordinary business attorney. Forbes Magazine calls her “One of the 25 Most Influential Women Tweeting about Entrepreneurship.”  The U.S. Small Business Administration named her their regional Women in Business Champion of the Year for her creative approaches to educating and advocating for small businesses. A trusted thought leader, Kaufman reaches over 2 million readers each month on Entrepreneur.com. For over 15 years, Kaufman has provided the legal counsel that NYC-based marketing, consulting, and creative companies need to avoid unknown legal risks as they grow and scale independent of their owners.  She’s particularly passionate about helping women business owners build their companies in a way that lets them add freedom to their lives and value to their balance sheets.

Panelist: Steven Rubin, Partner | Moritt Hock & Hamroff

An introduction to intellectual property protection and cybersecurity law for startup companies

Bio: Mr. Rubin has 15 years of experience in consulting clients on patent-related matters. He advises clients throughout all phases of a patent’s life from conception by an inventor to enforcement. He drafts and prosecutes patent applications and has managed large international patent portfolios. In addition, Mr. Rubin also identifies potential patent infringement assertions and potential cross-licensing opportunities and provides infringement opinions as needed. In the cybersecurity space, Mr. Rubin relies on his technology background in counseling clients and creating written information security plans (WISPs). Mr. Rubin focuses his practice on technology relating to electronics and computer science and has worked in diverse fields such as software; multi-core architecture; augmented reality; optical communication; information processing; image processing; security systems; videoconferencing; network based technologies, including cloud computing;mobile applications; search engines; military defense systems; physics; material science; encryption; chemical engineering; nanotechnology; medical devices; microlithography; RF-ID; fabrication and production of semiconductor devices; computer and network architecture and monitoring; circuits; coding/decoding, processing and transmission of signals; antennas; cell phone and pager technology; printer and display technology including LCD control; transmission, compression,synchronization, processing, and display of television signals; optical communications and lens technologies; mechanical devices; and lighting circuitry.

Networking Reception: refreshments will be provided.

results.description:
Come experience the holistic healing modality of Core Energetics for free!

Please note that this Meetup is only open to those who have not attended before as space is limited.

Core Energetics is a body-oriented psychotherapy that works with a person's emotional blocks, often held in the body. Life can be more joyful when old pain is released through energetic movement. We bring consciousness to old patterns to free ourselves and make lasting changes. Focusing on a holistic process involving body, emotion, mind and spirit, Core Energetics is a mode of healing that combines bodywork, psychotherapy and spiritual process. Core Energetics is applicable to many problems people face such as depression, anxiety, low self esteem, addiction, childhood and adult trauma, general dissatisfaction or a search for more meaning in their life. This method also works with stress management and chronic physical problems, including sexual dysfunction. A typical session consists of a combination of traditional talk therapy to bring consciousness and awareness to issues as well as various body movements to activate held energy in the body. Dr. John Pierrakos founded Core Energetics in 1978 and most forms of body psychotherapy and transpersonal work in the United States are informed by his work.
results.name: Introduction to Core Energetics  (Body-Oriented Psychotherapy)

Please join NAAAP-NY (National Association of Asian American Professionals) Toastmasters Open House, featuring award-winning professional speaker Todd McKinney.

Todd joined Toastmasters in 2007 and it has changed his life. He began his career as a professional musician, loving the creativity of Jazz and classical music, but now works as a writer and executive speech coach.He is a repeat District 46 Humorous Speech Champion - in 2008 and 2011.

Another top Toastmaster participating at our Open House is a Past President of District 46 (NYC metropolitan area) Elaine Rogers. Elaine works as President of LOMA Greater New York Society. She is an accomplished, dynamic, and client-driven training professional with over 25 years of progressive experience in training, presentation skills, facilitation, and curriculum design.Elaine is known for her outstanding ability to create dynamic, eye-opening, highly interactive, and fun educational experiences for her clients that exceed their highest expectations.

Gary Chiang, the President of ToastNAAAPsters will also be presenting at the event.

Come learn proven techniques on how to boost your professional image with clear communication. Give feedback effectively, emulate great speakers. Learn the craft of public speaking through practice in a safe, SUPPORTIVE environment with our experts.

ToastNAAAPsters officers

results.description:
Join us on April 25, 2016 at Brooklyn FoodWorks for a short film screener of Brooklyn Farmer + Q&A with author of The Farm on the Roof and co-founder of the Brooklyn Grange, Anastasia Cole Plakias. 


TICKETS PURCHASED THROUGH EVENTBRITE HERE. 

FOODSTANDERS LOOK OUT FOR A CODE ON APP COME WEDNESDAY, MARCH 30th AND IN EMAIL!

For the upcoming launch of our Food Book & Film Club, we'll be hosting a film screening of Brooklyn Farmer (2013) and having a Q&A + book signing with Brooklyn Grange's co-founder and author of the book The Farm on the Roof, Anastasia Cole Plakias at the Brooklyn FoodWorks Headquarters.


The night will revolve around what it means to run a small food business in New York with a special emphasis on maintaining one's values as one's business grows. If interested, preorder a book here. 

6:00PM: Doors open, food+drinks, networking, book purchases

6:30PM: Film screens (26 minutes)

7:00PM: Q&A with Anastasia of Brooklyn Grange & Representative of Brooklyn FoodWorks (moderated by Foodstand)

7:30PM: Audience questions

7:40PM: Book signing, networking, food+drinks, and wrap-up

8:15PM: Evening ends

More about the film and book:

BROOKLYN FARMER explores the unique challenges facing Brooklyn Grange, a group of urban farmers who endeavor to run a commercially viable farm across the rooftops of New York City.  As their growing operation expands to a second roof, the team confronts the realities inherent in operating the world’s largest rooftop farm in one of the world's biggest cities. (26 mins) 

THE FARM ON THE ROOF: In their effort to build the world’s first and largest commercial green rooftop farm, the founders of Brooklyn Grange learned a lot about building and sustaining a business while never losing sight of their mission. But their story is about more than just farming. It serves as an inspirational and instructional guide for anyone looking to start a business that is successful while making a positive impact.

results.description:
Please note that our group and our happy hours are not for non-Asians. 


We are continuing the ninth round of our icebreaker game. Since most of you are now accustomed to how the games work, we are going to ask old and new members to dig deeper and answer more personal questions to get to know one another better. 

As before, the game will start at 6:30 pm and will run until 7:30 pm. The first 25 matches will get a free drink ticket each! Here are the rules: 

1. Find a person with the same magical question printed on the rules card. 

2. Find out if your match has your same magical answer. 

After completing 1 and 2 above, find one of the organizers (Richard Young or Tiffany Ma) to get your free drinks (available only for the first 25 matches – so come on time!).

--

Our monthly happy hour is our flagship event that started it all years ago in 2005. Experience what it's all about -- come and meet fellow Asian professionals in a friendly, casual atmosphere. Relax after work and meet some new people.

Because this is a free event where you are not paying a cover or door fee, we humbly request that you please buy one drink or more to support our venue since they are turning away other business to allow us to host our event (buying alcoholic drinks/soft drinks/bottled water helps support the venue -- getting free tap/iced water does not).

First time to one of our events?  See photos from previous happy hours on Meetup or Facebook.

Hope to see you there!

Also find us on Facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/events/1276765455671733/

results.description:
Come for the sheer joy of moving to the music, in a nurturing and supportive setting.

Whether you have never danced before or want to continue, this is a class for you.

The classes are one hour and half in length and provide quality instruction.

Ballet is one of the most healthy and intense forms of dance.
It can provide a complete full-body workout, increasing your flexibility, range of motion and strength.

It’s also a great alternative to aerobics.

The classes are on-going, join in anytime.

PRICES Walk-Ins: $20.
Package: $180 for a card of 10 classes (over a course of 6 months).
Talk to us about multiple class per week discount!

ABOUT THE INSTRUCTOR
Bruce Weitzmon is a choreographer, dancer and teacher. His work has been presented in the U.S.A. and Canada. Bruce was the director of the Theater Dance Center, a non-profit dance education and performance organization in Rockland County, founded in 1981. After many years directing TDC, he returned to New York City to teach. Now after more than 10 years there, he is returning to offer a weekly schedule of classes in Nyack, NY.

VISIT US ON FACEBOOK
For more about the Dancers’ Art class schedule, rates or any additional information please visit and like Dancers’ Art on Facebook at www.facebook.com/DancersArt or call[masked]-1973.

results.description:
I am a Spanish native speaker and suggest we meet at Think Coffee to help you to improve your Spanish!

There is a maximum of 6 students per group and costs $10/person if more than 3 people come to the class and $15/person if 1 to 3 people come to the class.

My phone number is[masked] just in case you cannot find me.

Don´t sign up if you are not sure you can come.

The lesson lasts 1 hour.

Hasta pronto!

Beguinner level means: you are not able to speak without the help of the teacher, you just know really little common expresions. We will go thought the basics.

Intermediate level means: you can explain yourself with the help of the teacher, you can build up sentences but they are basic or you make mistakes on them. You have lacks of vocabulary and grammar.

Advanced level means: you are fluent in Spanish, you can explain yourself without a lof of problems. You know the vocabulary. Advanced students normally make gramatical mistakes when they talk and can forget some words, that is perfectly normal.
results.name: Spanish conversation Advanced. $10/person if more 3people or $15/p if less

Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

results.description:
This talk will take place right before our VR Jam Showcase event which starts at 7:30pm. Space is limited so RSVP early. Jesse Freeman will be presenting the following talk:

From Game Jam to Appstore


A lot of people will tell you how to earn a living by making games, but for many of us the joy comes from the process of building a game itself. For me, making games has become an obsession. Like the guy who is building a boat in his basement without thinking of how to get it out when it's finished I pour hours of my personal time into making games. I never think about my games being successful or making me rich. I make games because there is no other way I would want to spend my time! That’s why I love game jams and most of the games I make come from them. But when the jam is over, if I want people to play and enjoy my creation I have to get it out to the masses.

In this talk we'll explore the obsessive nature of game development and the desire to be successful. We’ll focus on how to take a raw jam game and polish it up into something ready to ship. Not every game has to be a monetary success to be rewarding. In most cases you'll find that just completing the game is satisfaction enough. Making games for fun - like any artistic expression - is as much about the journey as the destination.
results.name: Talk: From Game Jam to Appstore

results.description:
On April 25th, join cigar and scotch aficionados from across the tri-state area at SoHo Cigar Bar for a special cigar and whiskey night featuring two epic whiskies from Compass Box: The Peat Monster and Spice Tree. Guests will pair both scotches with La Pluma cigars, one of the most exciting cigar brands to emerge from New York City in over two decades.

Ticket includes:

1. One glass Compass Box The Peat Monster

2. One glass Compass Box Spice Tree

3. One La Pluma cigar

A limited number of early-bird tickets are available for $25.

After that, $30 online and $40 at the door. 

Dress code: business casual. Bring business cards for our raffle for free scotch!

About La Pluma Cigars


Blended by Jonathan Maccia at the world renowned Placencia factory in Esteli, Nicaragua, La Pluma Cigars is one of the newest and most exciting cigar brands to hit the U.S. market. The cigars are produced by the same family behind other releases from Casa Magna, Rocky Patel, Gurkha, and more. 

About Compass Box Whiskey

THE SPICE TREE was resurrected – matured using a custom-made cask with French oak for the heads and American oak for the bodies. SPICE TREE is a rich, intense malt whisky redolent of baking spices and layered with toasty oak accents that complement the underlying distillery character.

With PEAT MONSTER, you will find a spectrum of seaside and medicinal peatiness, along with kipper-like smokiness, all surrounding a core of fruity malt whisky character. THE PEAT MONSTER is a whisky for those who love intensity, flavour and freshness, balance and drinkability. A whisky for those who appreciate the blending of seemingly dissonant elements to create something sublime.

results.description:
We will power up the Major Welch, take in the sunset & socialize briefly at Perkins Tower, then descend on the AT.

We will meet in the main parking lot. If you are running late, you are welcome to catch up with the group if we have begun.

This is not a beginner hike. You should have some hiking experience and be getting regular exercise. While it is only four miles, there is significant elevation gain on the Major Welch.

Make sure you have a copy of the map, a headlamp, and minimum 2 liter of water. If you fall behind during the hike, you must be prepared to finish on your own. Faster hikers are not obligated to wait for slower hikers. Typically we meet at the parking lot and begin together. As we ascend, the group breaks off. We will do our best to reconvene at the peak and begin our descent together. The amount of time we spend at Perkins will depend upon the weather. You must feel comfortable hiking out on your own should you fall behind. We would love to have everyone join but due the nature of an evening event we can not make accommodations for those who are unable to hike independently. There is no sweep. If you are unsure whether or not this is for you, please email me with any questions.

Heavy rain cancels and would be determined that day if necessary.

Distance: about 4 miles

Gain: about 1200

Hike time: 2 - 3 hours

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike

results.description:
Our weekly Meet Up will take place at Scotty's Steakhouse and Comedy Cove in Springfield, just a bit off of exit 9B on Route 24! The address is 595 Morris Ave, Springfield.


There is a world of gaming outside of the traditional Monopoly, Scrabble, Risk, etc. Whether you're looking for something new and different, or you're a seasoned gamer, you'll find a friendly and welcoming bunch of friends to game with.  Be adventurous , come learn some new games or play your favorites!

We begin gathering around 6:30 pm and are fully underway by 7pm.

Because the event takes place at a restaurant that serves alcohol, there are strict rules against gambling of any form.  Guests under 21 are welcome, as it is a restaurant. Since they are letting us use the space for free, they expect that we will order food and drink, so there are some rules:

1.  No outside food or drink, not even bottled water.

2. Please plan on ordering food and/or drinks.  Support the venue.

3. Tip the waitstaff generously.  15% is standard, but 20% is even better. We want them to love having us there, and in this case, money does buy you love.


4. If you plan on attending regularly, please consider a small contribution to cover The Tipsy Meeple's costs for using Meetup.

We bring some of our games, but feel free to bring your favorites, or learn one of ours! And don't be shy about learning new games, we are more than willing to teach a new player! Can't wait to see you there.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be around the corner from the bar!
results.name: Game Night!

results.description:
Hey Ladies, it's time for the WSSL April .22 Rifle Shoot! Come join us at the Westside Range for our monthly .22 Rifle Shoot on April 25st! 

Have you always wanted to learn how to handle a firearm but didn't know where to start? Or do you have some (or a lot) of experience with guns but don't know where to shoot in the city? Then come join us for WSSL's monthly .22 rifle shoot!  Learn safe and responsible shooting skills with a group of fun and friendly ladies at the Westside Rifle and Pistol Range on April 25th. 


If you want to shoot with WSSL and you've never joined us before, please read the entire event description and start your registration process with Westside ASAP! 


Feel free to bring friends! (Remind them to register in advance!) All levels are welcome (never shot, beginners, intermediate, advanced). We will have some fun shooting drills, too! This meetup is limited to women, but we do have  co-ed shoots sporadically throughout the year, so keep posted!

Register here at least five days in advance: here: http://www.westsidepistolrange.com/registration.php?referral=WSSL&glemail=rsvp@nycwssl.org 

You will receive a "transaction ID" by e-mail from the Range. Please bring this with you and a photo ID.

Price: $35 (plus tax) to the range. You can pay the range after the event: cash, check or charge. This fee includes classroom safety instruction, private instruction on the firing line, rental of a .22 rifle, one box of ammo (additional ammo is available from WSSL while supplies last; please make a small donation to cover the cost of this ammo) and eye/ear protection. We also ask that you please donate $5 (or whatever you feel like donating) to WSSL directly to help cover our operating costs like our website fees, locker rental at the range, etc.

Come at 6:15 PM for the club business meeting and help us plan activities -- we have some great excursions in mind -- or join us from 6:30 PM - 8:30 PM for the shooting.

FIRST TIME SHOOTERS (First time shooting with us/Westside):

When you arrive at the Range on WSSL night pick up your brown ID card at the office. (Bring your transaction ID in case your brown ID card has not been prepared.) You will sign in using the Range ID number on your brown ID card every time you attend WSSL. 
You will also need to bring other ID with you to check in on WSSL night. 

RETURNING SHOOTERS:

E-mail Lauren Silberman at [masked] so that she can give the Range an accurate count. 
Use the Range ID number on your brown card to sign in when you arrive on WSSL night. 


WESTSIDE RANGE MEMBERS:

E-mail Lauren Silberman at [masked] so that she can give the Range an accurate count. 
On WSSL night sign in using your Range membership number. Range members do not pay the $35 WSSL fee, and WSSL will provide ammo while supplies last (please make a small donation to cover the cost of this ammo). 

ALL SHOOTERS:

If you've registered, but find that you can't attend, please e-mail Lauren at [masked] As soon as poosible so we have an accurate headcount for the Range. 
If you have to cancel at the last minute please call the Range directly at [masked] or [masked]-9448.
results.how_to_find_us: The range is downstairs. Just walk right in and ask for WSSL! See you there!
results.name: April .22 Rifle Shoot at Westside Range

results.description:
Our November discussion of “The Enlightenment and Romanticism” was so interesting that we agreed to continue the conversation in January. A blizzard killed that evening, so we’re catching up this month.

Scholar Mike Orzechowski has put together short passages on three Romantic icons – Victor Hugo, Wordsworth and Baudelaire – to guide our discussion.

The file is on the Calendar page for April 25, on the website, www.shsny.org, and you can (should!) read it in under half an hour.

NOTE: Studying Humanism is a study group. If you have not done the reading, you may still audit the discussion — all are welcome, definitely including newcomers!
results.name: Studying Humanism: "Romanticism & the Evolution of Humanism"

results.description:
THIS IS A PAID EVENT. PURCHASE YOUR TICKET HERE.

Morgan Hermand-Waiche (Adore Me)

Morgan Hermand-Waiche is founder and CEO of Adore Me, a disruptive e-commerce startup revolutionizing the lingerie industry, ranked #2 on the Inc. 500 list of fastest-growing companies in NYC. With $11.5M raised from VCs and private investors, Morgan leads a team of 82 employees across the US and Europe. results.description:
Education and Done-For-You Real Estate - We Help You Learn & Do Real Estate

Registration Required: http://wisewomeninvestinrealestate.eventbrite.com

There is a big difference between real estate strategies and real estate Game Plans. Examples of real estate strategies are flipping a home, buying wholesale, or buy and hold. A Game Plan, on the other hand, is the series of steps that are specific to you and customized to your goals, which also shows you how to implement those steps so that you can achieve your goals.

The purpose of the Game Plan is to discover what assets you have, how much time you are willing to spend, and how to multiply your assets in the future. The Game Plan will be specific to you, to your goals, your current circumstances and financial situation, and to the exact circumstances you hope to create in the future.

In summary, if you create a good real estate game plan, you will know where you are headed and how to get there. The end goal will likely be a real retirement with real residual income coming from something as simple as single-family residential investment real estate.

Some of the Topics Covered include:

Business Credit & FundingCreative Real EstateNo Money, No CreditPartneringLease OptionsFinding Your Power TeamHot Properties / Hot MarketsEconomic PatternsDesigning a Customized Game PlanCreating a Wealthy MentalityCreating a Tax Free Retirement3 Levels of Action Guaranteed to Make you More Money ImmediatelyHow to Increase the Purchasing Power of Each Dollar

No fee just a $15 food minimum required!

Registration Required: http://wisewomeninvestinrealestate.eventbrite.com

results.description:
In this course, we will build an ASP.NET Core application from scratch. Along the way we will learn about middleware, controllers, views, and models. We'll support SQL Server using the Entity Framework and user registration with the Identity Framework. We'll also see novel techniques for working with front end frameworks like Bootstrap and JavaScript libraries like jQuery. By the end of the course, you'll have everything you need to start building applications with the ASP.NET Core framework.

About the Author: Scott has worked on everything from 8-bit embedded devices to large scale web sites during his 15+ years in commercial software development. Since 2001, Scott has focused on server-side and web technologies, like ASP.NET, ASP.NET AJAX, Windows Workflow, Silverlight, and LINQ. Scott is also a speaker at national conferences like VSLive!, as well as code camps and user groups near his hometown of Hagerstown, MD.

Scott has been recognized as a Microsoft MVP since 2005, and has written or co-authored several books on Microsoft technologies. Scott founded the site OdeToCode.com in 2004, and joined Pluralsight in 2007.
results.name: ASP.NET Core 1.0 Fundamentals Week 4 of 5

results.description:
Abstract

This is part of our Introduction to Stan Workshop series. Please bring your laptop with Stan installed. You can use any of the Stan interfaces; the presenters will use the RStan interface for this workshop.


Daniel Lee and Eric Novik will walk through "A Probability Model for Golf Putting" paper and implement the model in Stan. You can download the dataset from here.

We will write the code as we speak and discuss all the components of the Stan program. We will also discuss some of the most important parameters for calling Stan and address common debugging strategies.

Our goal for this session is to get people started with expressing and fitting their models in Stan.


Logistics

A government issued ID is required. Guests will enter the building through the 76 9th Ave entrance on the corner of 16th and 9th by the Post Office.

Please come on time; it is difficult for Google to accommodate late arrivals. If you come after 7 pm, there is a good chance that we will not be able to let you in. Thank you for understanding and we hope to see you in April!
results.name: #11: Stan Workshop: A Probability Model for Golf Putting

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Monday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. 

Most people arrive at 6:30pm.  We use the first 30 minutes to talk, order food/drinks, and pick out games while we wait for any people that are a little late.  Promptly at 7pm we split into groups and play our games that typically take 2 hours to play.  So, if you arrive after 7pm there is a good chance that you will not be able to get into a game and can watch us play if you'd like.  At the end of the night we play a couple of additional shorter games that you can get into.

This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's (We are located 1 room over from the pool tables).  This group meets at the dining tables directly in front of the bowling lanes. There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Kingsburg, Stone Age, Lords of Waterdeep, Istanbul, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Splendor, Pirate's Cove, Five Tribes, Castles of Burgundy, and more.  

Here is a list of the board games I own on the BGG website: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/MarkNY8?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Here is a list of Co-Host Kenny's games on BGG: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/kenk1982?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark

Each soul confronts the 42 Confessions of Maat. Anubis weighs the heart against the feather of Maat and Osiris judges. The Rosicrucian mystical perspective of this myth is examined. Question and answer session will be followed by a meditation.

The facilitator,  E. Bernard West serves the Ancient Mystical Order Rosae Crucis (AMORC) and Traditional Martinist Order (TMO) as a lifetime member. During his many years of membership he is known for his expertise in Egyptian, Greek and Roman mythology.  He is a retired Army Officer who currently serves as the TMO Provincial Master in Georgia and  Grand Councilor  for Georgia and Louisiana for AMORC EGL. He also serves various masonic affiliations including Master of a Prince Hall Affiliated Blue Lodge, Patron of an Eastern Star Chapter, a Noble of the Mystic Shrine and Grand Inspector General 33ᵒ United Supreme Council. Bernard has a Master’s of Art in Political Science and a PhD in American Studies and is a published author.

The discussions will take place Monday through Friday from 6:30 pm to 7:30 pm.

results.description:
Another interesting talk presented by The New York Academy of Sciences, followed by a reception. These events SELL OUT quickly. Register here: 
http://www.nyas.org/Events/Detail.aspx?cid=11ba4774-43e3-457e-9687-dfde46df908d

$15 for non-members, $5 for members, or purchase tickets to the entire 6 event series for a discount. Description:
For centuries, physics and philosophy walked side by side in pursuit of their shared goal—understanding the nature of reality. The progress of science has pushed the frontier of physics into the realm of advanced mathematics, which requires technical skill and levels of abstraction attainable only after years of dedicated training. At the same time, most physicists today do not receive training in philosophy and epistemology, few have the time to ponder philosophical implications of their work, and some even doubt the possibility of a meaningful dialog between physicists and philosophers. However, at its core, physics addresses the fundamental problems that shape our philosophical outlook. Join our distinguished panel including writer Jim Holt, philosophers Tim Maudlin and David Z. Albert, and science writer Kate Becker in a dialogue that explores the philosophical meaning of the theories of modern physics—including quantum field theory, cosmology, and quantum gravity—and considers the ability of physics as a scientific discipline to answer the question: how can it be like that?
results.name: NYAS: Where Do Physics and Philosophy Intersect?

We'll meet on the southwest corner of John F. Murray Park (45th Rd. and 11th St.) at 7:00pm for our 4ish mile loop around LIC. 

You can run at your own comfortable and totally non-competitive pace and know that we'll never leave you behind. 

We usually head to the pub for beverages and/or snacks afterward - Bring some cash if you would like to participate in our post-run social time. 

For our evening runs, we will wait up to 5 minutes to allow for late-arrivals. Please be prompt. 

As always, if you have any comments, ideas or suggestions, please let us know!
results.name: Monday Evening 4ish Mile Run

results.description:
This is a class in technique although, when you've conquered a song technically, then I will coach musicality and performance. Class size is limited. Fee is $20/per. You may audit the class once (without participating) for $10. Let me know when you sign up if that's your intention.

Room assignment will be printed on the electronic billboard opposite the elevators on floor 16.

People at the front desk are helpful and friendly and the Cafe on the floor has great coffee and cookies, sandwiches, <a>pizza</a>, etc.

I've been asked to post this:

Dear Members: I am Mr. Harrington's agent/rep. Mr. Harrington teaches privately coaching established actors and singers. For years his private rate has been $120/hr for this service. He started teaching through Meetup earlier this year and has as his goal to bring professional level instruction to the public at a rate that leaves no one behind. This demands tight scheduling of both his time and the room rental with Ripley-Grier Studios.For these reasons, I will be insisting to him that "no shows" be dropped from the group. The policy is this: If you RSVP you better show up. If you cancel you better do this by 4:00 pm the previous day.A word to the wise...Michael T. Harvey
results.how_to_find_us: The electronic billboard at the studio will show the up-to-date room.

results.description: A warm welcome to Scottish country dancing! Come and enjoy the fun! Everyone is welcome! (Please remember to bring soft-soled shoes.) We will be providing instruction starting with the basics. Then we'll have a break followed by one more dance for everyone. After that the instruction will be geared to experienced country dancers!

results.description:
• Awaken your body and mind’s innate healing powers
• Develop healthier and more fulfilling relationships
• Learn to work constructively with your own emotions
• Stimulate your minds innate problem solving capabilities
• Develop new resources and capabilities
• Become clear about your life’s purpose
Develop your intuition by tapping into the innate intelligence that resides within your body and mind
Our bodies communicate with us all the time. Many of us are so over stimulated and stressed out that we cannot hear what our bodies are saying. We age faster and suffer many health problems when we do not know how to listen to what our body is telling us.
Discover the amazing wisdom that resides within your own body. Ben will show you how to develop your sensory awareness. Learn to truly listen to your body and care for its needs.
Stimulate the mind's creative problem solving capabilities by learning to "digest" issues, emotions and stresses
Many of us have never learned how to work with difficult issues and emotions. We tend to push these things down inside of ourselves. Undigested thoughts, issues, emotions and the stresses of daily life create a residue that accumulates within the tissues and organs of our bodies. That creates a great deal of additional stress upon our body and mind. These stresses can arrest our process of development, disconnect us from the divine creative intelligence of the universe and shut down our intuition. It also causes our bodies break down at a more rapid pace and that accelerates the aging process.

Learn to use your body-mind's innate healing power to "digest and assimilate" your thoughts feelings, emotions, issues and life experiences. You will begin to release the stresses that are held within the body and to heal the painful emotions associated with anxiety, depression and emotionally traumatic experiences. You will also learn to go right to the source of the issues to bring about a resolution that allows you to really move forward in your life.
Working with these practices helps to increase your intellectual and emotional range, improve memory, initiate new cycles of growth, awaken inner passions, spark creativity and deepen intuition. You will develop the strength and resilience that will make it easier for you to adapt to the demands that life places upon you.
Discover the passion and power that resides within you
Chinese Martial Arts Masters emphasize the development of a base of power known as the "dan tien". The stress of living in such a fast paced world can cause us to disconnect from our foundation. Undigested food, emotions and the stresses of daily life begin to accumulate within the abdomen. We may experience bloating and suffer from various digestive problems. Some of us begin to lose touch with our drive, passion, inspiration and the sense of knowing that reveals our true purpose as our instinctual base shuts down.

You will learn to become fully present within your body, to develop greater personal power, and to awaken the inner passion and sense of knowing that will bring give you a greater sense of clarity about your life's purpose.

Activate the healing intelligence that resides within the body and mind
We all have a powerful healing intelligence that resides within our bodies and minds. This innate healing power helps to mend our bodies any time we suffer an illness or injury. Our innate healing powers are often compromised by the stress and toxins that accumulate within our bodies.
Learn to activate the generative healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Awaken the consciousness of the individual organs. Access and heal the emotions and core issues that are held within the body. These practices are very effective for healing digestive and respiratory disorders and a wide range of other health issues.


Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.

I will be happy to answer any questions that you have about how you can awaken the healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Let me know in advance about your individual needs and concerns and we will address these issues during class.

Please only YES RSVP if you are coming to the group
