results.description:
Registration begins: 5:30 pm to 6 pm.

Program begins promptly at 6 pm.

MC: Nina Pascucci

First Speaker: Mr. Martin Drake

Martin (Marty) A. Drake, Chief, Science and Technology Division & Command Science Advisor, U.S. Central Command. He will be talking about USCENTCOM, its concerns in the USCENTCOM Area of Responsibility (AOR), and the requirements of USCENTCOM.


U.S. Naval Academy graduate with a Bachelor of Science in Systems Engineering and a Master of Arts in National Security and Strategic Studies from the U.S. Naval War College.  Completed the Senior Executive Fellows course at Harvard’s Kennedy School of Government.

Served 28 years in the U.S. Navy as a Surface Warfare Officer in five separate ships; commanding two – USS PEGASUS (PHM-1) and USS THORN (DD988).  Focus while assigned in surface ships was Weapons and Combat Systems.  Held principal staff positions ashore in the U.S. Naval Academy (Instructor), Commander-in-Chief, U.S. Atlantic Fleet (Chief of Exercises), Naval Amphibious School (Deputy Director for Total Quality Leadership), a first tour in Commander, U.S. Central Command (Chief of Exercises; Division Chief, Transformation and Integration; Deputy Director, Resources and Assessment); and Office of the Secretary of Defense (Military Advisor to the Director, Defense Research and Engineering).

Currently employed as the Chief of Science and Technology Division and Command Science Advisor to U.S. Central Command located in Tampa, Florida.  Directs a staff chartered to conduct discovery, research, analysis, and sponsor development of new and emerging technologies and techniques which have the potential to provide solutions to Headquarters and Component validated Joint needs.  Additionally, pursues integrating and non-material solutions to satisfy current and future military operational capability gaps.  Holds a Level III Systems Planning, Research, Development, and Engineering (SPRDE) qualification for Technology Management.  Frequently lectures on technology impacts to the current and future military force. 

Second Speaker: Jerry Hultin


Urban life is exploding around the world: in the next 3 decades, cities will expand to include 3 billion more people, many of them under 30 years of age. As a result, cities around the world — including the United States — are under greater and greater stress: congestion and pollution; infrastructure in desperate need of repair and expansion, citizens expecting greater access via mobile and the cloud, flat economies, and overly leveraged with debt. One very easily can paint a bleak picture of the urban future.

Yet, by combining the innovative insights and spirit of citizens with the technological advances of the 21st century — mobile phones, sensors, GPS, data and advanced analytics, the internet and the cloud — the world is seeing exciting new approaches to these urban challenges. 

Join with me in my role as chairman of Global Futures Group and take a look at this future. Together, we can identify new opportunities for growth and change here in NYC and around the world. Join me in learning how you can be one of the growing number of citizens, entrepreneurs, innovators, non-profits, small businesses, and high-tech corporations who are designing and building the smart cities of the coming decade. At the same time, I will let you know how you can participate in NYC’s first “smart cities” week coming in the spring of 2017. 

Third Speaker: Anastacia Marx de Salcedo

Author of Combat-Ready Kitchen: http://anastaciamarxdesalcedo.com/about-the-book/


From Army Chow to Snack Food: Lessons from 70 Years of Technology Transfer from the Military to the Food Industry

Anastacia Marx de Salcedo is the world's foremost expert on military technology transfer to the food industry, and an expert on military technology transfer and food processing. In 2015, she published Combat-Ready Kitchen: How the U.S Military Shapes the Way You Eat, which received considerable national and international attention. She has been an entrepreneur, having started two successful businesses, one in public health research and communications and the other in publishing, and began her career doing policy research on public-private partnerships. She was born in New York City, graduated from Columbia College, and lives in Boston.


Fourth Speaker: Geoff Orazem


Innovation efforts and small business engagement across the US Government

This talk will discuss the various innovation and small business programs (contracting and grants) across the US Government. Attendees will learn where they should look for funding and support opportunities and how to access them.

Geoff Orazem is the CEO and Founder of Eastern Foundry, an incubator for government contractors in Crystal City VA. Geoff is a former Marine infantry platoon commander who served in the invasion of Iraq in 2003. Following the Marine Corps he attended Harvard Law School after which he returned to Iraq as a Tribal Affairs officer with the Iraqi Transportation Network (ITN). Following the ITN he began working in McKinsey and Co.'s DC office as an Engagement Manager. 

Lightning Talks:

David Rios, SOCOM IAC

Alec Hartman, CEO of TechDay, Co-Founder of DigitalOcean

Brendan Hart, Prosper

Juanita Koilipillai, Waverley Labs


Sean Petterson, StrongArm Technologies

Nicolas Visnick, BotFactory

Networking Reception: Refreshments will be provided

Meetup Mashup Participants:

Technology Transfer Days Meetup: http://www.meetup.com/Technology-Transfer-Days/

Information Architecture Meetup: http://www.meetup.com/information_architecture/

Semiotics Web Meetup: http://www.meetup.com/SemioticsWeb/

OWASP Brooklyn Meetup: http://www.meetup.com/OWASP-Brooklyn/

Do you require any special accommodations? If so, please let us know: [masked]

results.description:
This event is currently at its maximum and is closed to new players.

From humble beginnings, a handful of lost souls must rise above their misfortune to achieve greatness.

The uncountable islands of the subtropical Korina Archipelago are the sanctuary for many who have fled from the never-ending wars of distant Altamere. That land, where the life of the common man is cheap and reckless kings all-too-often burn their lives, and kingdoms, out in blazes of glory.

The Korina Archipelago is home to several large city-states, each of which views the others as rivals, but generally coexist, for there are greater threats to their safety. Renegade Altameran privateers, depraved nation-less pirates, demon-worshiping cannibals, horrors from the uncharted oceans, and far worse are reminders for the city-states of the constant dangers that exist outside their walls. 

These dangers are all-too-real, and to whom can one turn to in times of desperation and need when threats arise? Each city-state will defend its own, but outside that, help is not easy to come by. Even the enlightened gods favor all, yet they favor none; those whose prayers and sacrifices are the most persuasive bend their ears for a time. The gods are powerful and wise, but fickle they are, too, and to understand their ways is not the way of man.

This is no place for the weak of heart. Salvation comes from strength and strength alone. The strong survive, the weak do not. This is the tale of the rising of heroes, the elevation of men from what they were to what they are, the making of the great from the small, this is the story of ascension.
results.name: Ascension: The Isle of Dread

results.description:
"When women learn to speak the language of men, they can bring out the best in them.”

AWC-NNJ is sponsoring this exciting Spring Workshop to give you the tools to build long lasting connections with the men in your personal & professional life. You will learn to win the heart of your mate, gain the trust of your business associates,  and protect the aliveness of your sons. The workshop will open your eyes to the protective nature of men and show you how to win that warrior over to your side

In this experiential, shockingly honest class you will:

Learn how to transform ordinary or conflict-ridden relationships with men, into super-charged power partnerships
•  Bond deeply with other curious women
•  Re-charge your feminine battery
•  Discover new dimensions of loving kindness
•  Experience the power of playing versus fighting
•  Learn how to give in to get your way
•  Rehearse conversations with men that lead to win-win outcomes

This interactive workshop will have you practicing the tools of Appreciation and Playfulness among participants to see if you are getting warmer or colder in your approach to people.  This workshop will give you two tools to go home with to practice building more rewarding connections.

Tuesday, April 26, 2016

6:00 pm: Networking and Dinner
7:00 pm: Workshop

Dinner included.
$5 for AWC NNJ chapter members
$10 for Dress For Success members and students with valid ID
$15 for general public and non-members

Beverly Dombroski, our Facilitator, is a CEO, owner of BeverlyD.LuxOrganic Hair Care, Certified Business & Lifestyle Mentor, Coach and Celebrity Stylist.  BeverlyD's Lifestyle division offers workshops and coaching for business, entrepreneur, and lifestyle improvement and growth as well as relationship development. These tools not only help us with communicating with men, but with anyone, our customers, colleagues, family and best friends.  Wouldn't that be a great support to you to create better connections with the people around you?

results.name: SPRING WORKSHOP: HOW TO SPEAK TO MEN

group.name: Association for Women in Computing NNJ Meetup Group

results.description:
RSVP: https://www.findspark.com/event/no-stress-networking/  

At a Glance:

Stressed about your thesis? Tired of everyone asking you if you have a job yet? Need a break? Unsure about what you want? Does that freak you out? Then you need to come to this event.

Take a break from your priorities. Take a break from your finals and all of the other crazy things happening in your life. If you’re still “figuring it out” this event is for you.

Come and talk high level about your career and find a safe space to vent and tell your story to other kindred spirits. This event will allow you to create a powerful network and take a moment to breathe – all at the same time. Meet like-minded people and hear from motivational speakers who will allow you to de-stress and go into the weeks to come with your head held high.

Who You’ll Meet:

Check Event Page


Why Attend?

We know you’re sick of people asking you what you’ll do after college. You’ve barely gotten over the fact that you’re graduating – how are you supposed to know what you want to do with your life? If you don’t have a job yet, that’s okay. Take a moment to recenter yourself. Take a moment to breathe. At this event, you’ll be able to sit back, relax, and hear from inspirational speakers who will leave you feeling less stressed and more confident about yourself.

This event will include:

Learning how to network and tell your story with confidencePractice talking about yourself in a no-stress environment. There will be no recruiters at this event. This is about you.Venting about your concerns and confusions about the upcoming weeksOne to one feedback sessions with CEO Emily Miethner with any questions you may haveOne to ones with a rep from Wix.com who will be there to give feedback and help you create a stellar online presenceStaying positive during the job search (we’re here to cheer you on!)How it Works: Don’t come to this event if you’re not ready to vent and voice your concerns or if you already have a job. This event is for people who need a break from their semester to focus on themselves and feel reassured that they’re doing it right.

You’ll also have the chance to chat with our speakers in small, intimate breakout sessions to get personal feedback and ask any questions.

You’ll leave this event with:

The confidence and knowledge that you are not aloneA feeling of pride that you took a moment to decompressA professional headshot to share on your social media profiles This event is your moment to de-stress with people who are stressed, just like you.
results.name: No-Stress Networking: A Job Hunt Event for 2016 Grads

venue.name: Lincoln Center - Elinor Bunin Film Center auditorium

results.description:
The event is FREE


A special conversation 


Join us as we explore the intersection between emotion and technology. Humans have continually created objects and tools to augment and enhance relationships. What happens when everyday objects begin to function as extensions of mental and emotional experiences? How do these enchanted objects end up influencing the people who interact with them and what stories are perceived and/or created in order to make sense of the world that surrounds us?

Speakers for the evening...

Robin Stern, Ph.D associate director for the Yale Center for Emotional Intelligence and Tucker B. Harding who's work examines communication theory and digital humanities at Columbia University. 


Come rapidly prototype an Enchanted Object

Then stick around for a special Sherlock Holmes & the Internet of Things session. Step into a global storytelling experiment with over 1,200 collaborators from 60+ countries. 

This is a hands-on session with new technology from Sam Labs and also an opportunity to co-create a special experience that will premiere in the Convergence section of the New York Film Festival later this fall. Together we'll re-imagine the work of Arthur Conan Doyle as we transform Lincoln Center into a massive connected crime scene for a live audience. 


About the program

Sherlock Holmes & the Internet of Things is a prototype from theDigital Storytelling Lab at Columbia University School of the Arts. We're pleased to be partnering with the Film Society of Lincoln Center on this exciting year-long program. For more info please visit http://sherlockholmes.io
results.name: Emotional Technology: telling stories with the Internet of Things

Happy Hour is extended for our group: $6 All Drafts, Well drinks, and House Wine. We encourage you to come as close to 6pm as you can, but showing up anytime between 6 and 8 PM is absolutely fine!


We will bring a few different games each time but if you have a game you want to bring, please do! Feel free to bring friends. Please have $2 cash when you arrive - this helps cover the cost of the meetup.com fees and to buy new games each month.

Space is limited, but don't let the wait list status keep you from attending. Please feel free to come down and we guarantee you will have fun.

results.description:
Join us in our monthly professional business networking event. Healthcare related students and professionals are all welcome!

Mission: 


The Healthcare Social Network is a group of like-minded professionals that promotes entrepreneurship and the exchange of creative ideas to improve and promote advancements in the healthcare community.

Our environment: 
The HCSN currently hosts networking events on a monthly basis, predominantly in Manhattan during happy hour. An environment consisting of - and shaped by - welcoming and friendly professionals, our aim is to attract those in healthcare across the entire spectrum. In any one of our events, you’ll find professionals working in direct care, in healthcare business development, and even medical students! Our hope is that the casual atmosphere of our events engender any number of takeaways, from a career connection, to advice and guidance, to simply having an opportunity to debrief after work by sharing stories.

Attire: business casual, however scrubs are also allowed

Remember to bring your business cards with you :)

Special thanks to MedTriarch Group's event team for organizing this event!
results.how_to_find_us: We're the geeks that walk around with special name tags.

results.description:
63+ RSVPs through Eventbrite so far - https://www.eventbrite.com/e/alleyboost-food-20-tickets-22705049414


M. Wazihullah, Professor at Mercy College will be hosting a Food Tech panel featuring special guests Alex Lorton, Co-Founder, Cater2.me, Daniel Buelhoff, CEO & Co-Founder, YummChef, Kris Schumacher, Co-Founder, Nextdoorganics, and Allison R. Stewart, Strategic Partnerships Manager, FOODX.

Topics that will be covered include how important technology is in the food industry, how technology impacts food businesses, how technology differs from B2B food startups to B2C startups, the sorts of technological innovations that you should expect to see in the food space, and more.

Join us for a Food Tech focused evening:


6 – 6:15pm: Enjoy Light Refreshments and Hors d’Oeuvres

6:15 – 6:45pm: Startup Feedback: 3 startup pitches with feedback from our panel of experts

6:45 – 7:30pm: Panel

7:30 – 7:45pm: Q & A Between the Panel/Crowd

7:45 – 8pm: Business Development Networking: Mix and Mingle with the Audience and Panelists

M. Wazihullah, Moderator  

Born in a corrugated iron hut in Bangladesh with no running water, Wazi came to America to study Electrical Engineering (Univ of Pennsylvania), Finance (Wharton), and an MBA (Stanford University). Working as an Investment Banker, Venture Capitalist and Management Consultant (The Boston Consulting Group) gave Wazi the tools to become an Entrepreneur – starting companies he has sold, run or folded.  

Alex Lorton, Co-Founder, Cater2.me 

Alex is a native Ohioan who went east to learn the ins and outs of business by earning his BS in Economics from the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania. After graduating, he put his education to work as a strategic management consultant for Oliver Wyman, focusing on Technology and Operations. In 2010, Alex moved out west to San Francisco to co-found Cater2.me. Outside of the office, Alex is an accomplished marathoner who can’t say no to a carb-heavy meal. However, he always says no to onions. 

Daniel Buelhoff, CEO & Co-Founder, YummChef


Daniel is a serial entrepreneur from Berlin, Germany. Daniel originally started his first business - Digital Media agency B&F/Outperformedia, before co-founding gaming company Smeet end of 2006. Smeet was venture-backed with €12 million, grew to more than 27 million users and millions in annual revenues, before being acquired by Angaros Group mid of 2014. Along this journey Daniel also co-founded micro company builder SpringTechVentures, which led to building new startups like StoyoMedia, YummChef and Gourmesso. The latter advanced to be the online market leader for Nespresso compatible coffee capsules in Germany and the US, being profitable within the first three months and annual revenues in the mid 7 digit range after not even two years. 

Kris Schumacher, Co-Founder, Nextdoorganics 

Kris was raised in rural Rhode Island and moved to Brooklyn in order to pursue a career in film. As the technical director of a boutique special effects house, he got his first taste of the start-up life developing disruptive new digital technologies that helped to open new markets. After working on a number of award winning independent films, he enrolled in Babson’s entrepreneurial-focused MBA program and went on to hold director level marketing and finance positions at two multinational corporations, but still could not let the entrepreneurship dream go. Having been born into a farming family, Kris has always been committed to sustainable agriculture systems. This was the impetus for the creation of Nextdoorganics, which he co-founded as a way to expand access to sustainable local produce. In addition to helping direct the continued growth of Nextdoorganics, he also teaches pricing for entrepreneurs at Pratt’s Center for Sustainable Design Strategies, is the co-founder of SandCrate.com, a partner in CocoaCompassion, and a co-founder and consultant for several other stealth stage food industry start-ups. 

Allison R. Stewart, Strategic Partnerships Manager, FOODX  

Allison is responsible for developing an ecosystem of community partners, organizations, investors, and individuals to fuel the success of FOOD­X portfolio companies. With 10 years of experience studying and working in sustainable agriculture and food systems, her experiences include creating a social enterprise plan for the Akshaya Patra Foundation, managing the Greene Hill retail food co­operative, student organizing, volunteering on farms around the globe, and urban beekeeping. Allison holds a MA in Food Systems from NYU and a BA from Macalester College.

Thank you to our sponsors!

Fiverr® gives you instant access to millions of Gigs from people who love what they do. It's the easiest way for individuals and businesses to get everything done, at unbeatable value. Fiverr is the world's largest marketplace for creative and professional services, currently listing over 3 million Gigs in more than 100 different categories across 196 countries. 

Balsamiq is the maker of Mockups - http://balsamiq.com/products/mockups - the rapid wireframing software that combines the simplicity of paper sketching with the power of a digital tool so that teams can focus on what's important. Balsamiq is a small and personable company that competes on usability and customer service. Balsamiq believes work should be fun, and that life is too short for bad software.

Moisan Legal P.C. utilizes technology to foster a collaborative client/attorney interaction. Our goal is to be your ongoing strategic resource and enable your business to operate effectively.


Facilitated Growth is a business and management consultancy committed to assisting entrepreneurs seeking expansion through the various phases of the business cycle.

All sales are final.

results.description:
What makes plants grow is a simple enough question, but the answer turns out to be one of the most complicated and fascinating stories in science and took over 300 years to unravel. Timothy Walker, director of the Oxford University Botanic Garden, reveals how the breakthroughs of Swedish botanist Carl Linnaeus, Chelsea gardener Phillip Miller and English naturalist John Ray created the science of botany. Between them these quirky, temperamental characters unlocked the mysteries of the plant kingdom and they began to glimpse a world where bigger, better and stronger plants could be created. Nurseryman Thomas Fairchild created the world's first artificial hybrid flower - an entirely new plant that didn't exist in nature. Today, botanists continue the search for new flowers, better crops and improved medicines to treat life-threatening diseases. 


For more information call[masked] or email [masked].

Sponsored by the Indoor Gardening Society of New York


About the Indoor Gardening Society...

IGS is a great way to introduce adults and children to the importance of green plants. The more you know about botany and growing things, the more you understand their impact on every aspect of your life and their importance to human survival. Plants are determining factors in many aspects of human history and development. Plants will beautify your home, heighten your appreciation of the outdoors and bring it inside for you to enjoy year-round. At each of our 10 monthly meetings per year members enjoy:

-a lecture or program about a horticulture-related topic

-a plant sale making rare and unusual plants available at reasonable prices

-an exhibition of spectacular specimens often unknown to people outside the plant hobbyist world and often unseen at botanical gardens.

-access to supplies and information that can turn anyone from a novice to a successful grower

Try us out at any meeting for free! Monthly (except July and August) meeting details available here and on Facebook about the third week of each month.

Become a member of IGS and receive a free plant on the spot!

-$25 yearly membership includes your entire family

More info at the Facebook page of the Indoor Gardening Society of New York or call[masked] or email [masked]. We look forward to seeing you!

This meetup group was started by the founder of the DaniWeb.com IT Discussion Community who was getting frustrated that all of the meetups she was interested in attending were based in NYC, and it was nearly impossible to get to them on weeknights for people who work out on Long Island.

Join a group of people who work in the tech industry throughout Long Island.

We are a very informal group consisting mostly of web developers and IT consultants, with the occasional application developer thrown into the mix. We talk about the latest projects we're working on and get help and feedback from each other.

The meetup starts at 6 pm but running as late as 10 or 11 pm (sometimes even later!) is the norm. People typically arrive anytime between 6 pm and 9 pm, so don't miss out just because you can't get there by 6. There's usually an early crowd and a late crowd.

results.description:
On April 26th we'll hold a private screening of All My Friends Are Married. The Black TV & Film Collective's first content launch. Come out and meet the cast and crew, and participate in a discussion on the topic of "Expectation Shedding". The conversation will center around the expectations placed on women in societies around the world as it relates to family and marriage. 

A little more about the series:

ALL MY FRIENDS ARE MARRIED is a quirky comedic webseries with a blend of dry and physical humor.  It highlights the joys, mistakes, hopes and pitfalls of being single & living in New York City. With tenderness, joy and irony we  present the story of a women  struggling to survive adulthood from her very imaginative point of view.  This series captures the  intersection where heaven meets earth; where adulthood and dreams force reality. It is here that faith, hope and love collides with bills, delayed promises and fears. 

We think it’s hilarious and we think you will too.

https://vimeo.com/161374004


Looking forward to seeing everyone there and having a discussion following.

6:00-6:30 Networking

6:30-7:00 Nonprofit panel

7:00-7:30 Q&A; group discussion. 

7:30-8:00 Give/Gets + additional networking time

For this event we will explore the intersection between EdTech and community oriented nonprofits. We will hear from a panel of nonprofits, and then break out into small groups for deeper discussions.

Nonprofits are essential to the fabric of many urban school systems. Historically, nonprofits have been a great source of innovation in public education systems. Today, nonprofits continue to originate innovative practices that are applied in schools, and they also partner with other innovators, including EdTech companies. For some EdTech companies, nonprofits have been integral to their growth strategies.

We will hear from a panel of innovative nonprofits that have partnered with EdTech companies:  

kecia Hayes, TC REACH

Kate del Priore, Schools that Can

Lucy Herz, Student Success Network

Wenimo Okoya, Children's Health Fund

* If you are working on a project that's related to this topic, please let us know! We are interested in using real challenges as the foundation of our small group discussions.

Join the Ben Appelbaum Foundation and Sunny Day Marketing for a FREE marketing workshop open to small business owners and nonprofit leaders.


So: how’s your email list? Is it growing steadily – or a bit stagnant? And when’s the last time you actually contacted them? If you are ready to develop a great list of email addresses to start marketing to, you need a plan! This seminar will help you identify how to gather contacts of people interested in your organization whereverthey find you, plus provide tips, technologies and tactics for keeping your contacts organized and segmented for easier, more effective targeted marketing. 


In this session you will learn how to:

• Get started with gathering email contacts

• Establish an organized contact segmentation process

• Grow your email lists online and in person

• Keep your subscribers interested & engaged after they sign up 


Learn some great strategies for collecting and managing your contact list -- so you can start to grow your email list, expand your reach and achieve your goals!
results.name: Quick & Easy Ways To Grow Your Email List

Tuesday is Arduino night at Fat Cat Fab Lab!

We have lots more Arduinos, breadboards, and parts, so bring your laptop and come join us for a fun hands-on learning experience.

As usual, people are welcome to come and work on their own projects, and we will show new users how to install the Arduino development software on their laptops and get started connecting sensors and output devices. 


                       ===================================


Above: From our April 19 meetup.  We'd like to thank Microchip Senior Field Applications Engineer Mark Hofmann and Karen Drucker, Microchip Client Engagement for Manager NY Metro Area for organizing and providing free MPLAB Xpress Evaluation Boards.   They worked in conjunction with Marc McComb, Senior Engineer Marketing Applications who remotely via WebEx took us through a hands-on  exercise with the MPLAB X IDE development tools.

Stay tuned - we are planning future Microchip product presentations.

--------------------------------------------------------------

Stewart Newfeld, our Arduino Tuesdays host has a an Electrical Engineering degree from Rutgers University, years of industry experience, and loves to teach and share his enthusiasm for making things. He enjoys ordering those so-inexpensive electronic parts from ebay and Aliexpress and having them show up like little toys two to three weeks later in his mailbox. He is president of Zebra Systems, Inc. where he develops websites with the Joomla Open Source CMS.

--------------------------------------------------------------

results.description:
Are you interested in Viral Content? Have you wondered if it could work for you business? Do you know what kind of results you could get? In this short evening, our speakers will share lots of case studies and personal stories from their own successful, and unsuccessful, attempts to generate viral content. 

GET TICKETS

You’ll not only find out what they did, why they did and how they did it, but also what the results were and how these strategies impacted both their businesses… and their personal lives. 

We’ll demystify the viral world and deconstruct the success factors in our own experiments. 

Our evening will be interactive, edifying, and fun, featuring perspectives on the latest and greatest in marketing strategy tech from New York-based industry experts. 

You’ll get a chance to meet and mingle with the speakers and get any question answered in our unusual approach to a Q&A open mic session

***Strategy & Tactics Presentations***

1. "Cracking the Facebook Code" Presented by Maia McCann, Editor in Chief at LittleThings, 5th Largest Facebook Publisher

2. "The Two Laws of Viral-ity"  Presented by David Guilfoyle, Inventor of the First Facebook Survey App

3. “Mr. Blog Goes to Washington” Presented by Keith Reynolds, Managing Director of ChiefPackagingOfficer.com  

"Counterintuitive Tips for Creating Viral Content"  Presented by Jonathan Allen, Former Director of Search Engine Watch [masked])

GET TICKETS

 * * * Open Mic Networking with Beer & Pizza * * * 

Here’s where it gets really fun. We’re well aware that every attendee is an expert at Startup Socials NYC, so we’ll host a short Q&A segment where you can get any questions answered - and even answer other audience members questions. 

Hobnob with your fellow attendees, the speakers, and the event organizers. Make friends, make connections, but most importantly, have great conversations. Previous attendees loved this portion of the evening-- what can we say? We know how to throw a well-connected party. P.S. if you don’t like beer, we’ll also have wine. If you don't like those, we'll have seltzer and soft drinks. If you don't like pizza... Erm... what would you prefer?

GET TICKETS

 * * * What You Can Expect From This Event * * * Real viral content case studies with real data any question answered (by entrepreneurship & digital marketing experts) Rub shoulders with like-minded local legends in the New York digital marketing industry A jolly good time with beer and pizza

results.description:
6:00pm - doors open, mingle, networking

6:30pm - 8:00pm - DC/OS has the ability to run on every private and cloud instance, anywhere and is now open source. In this talk, Vishnu Mohan, Solutions Architect at Mesosphere, will explain the momentum behind the “single computer” abstraction that has put DC/OS at the center of one of the most exciting architecture shifts in recent information technology history. He will demo a DC/OS install and walk through the UI. He will outline how the DC/OS community is empowering the new class of “datacenter developers” to program directly against datacenter resources, and draw correlations to how the Linux revolutionized the server industry.

Once your cluster is running, Keith Gelles, Chief Product Officer of Elodina, will walk through a sample Platform as Service build with Kafka, Storm, Cassandra, Hadoop and Spark. You haven't seen lambda until you have seen this!
results.name: DC/OS in the Modern Datacenter

results.description:
Welcome to The Inspired Businesswoman Happy Hour!

We'll be gathering at Applebee's  bar area or regular tables depending on how many of us are there.  Come ready to chat and get better acquainted. It's always fun when we meet. Food and drink are dutch treat.

Hope you'll join us!!

P.S. Bring a friend or two. 

************************************************************

Here is more about this group:

"Inspired" means to "breathe life into".  This group is dedicated to breathing life into YOU, the woman **behind** the business, career, non-profit, or family.  It's a personal-growth, nurture, connection group to fuel the woman first, which then gives her the energy and motivation to serve others.

We are a group of women who have ideas, visions, and a mission to bring to the world. 

We are corporate professionals, business owners, leaders, mothers, non-profit professionals, and entrepreneurs.

We believe in the power of positive thinking, The Secret, What you think about you bring about, The Law of Attraction, and the like.  We're open-minded and accepting of all beliefs as long as they aren't exclusive, negative, or judgmental.  We believe there is more than enough for everyone and have an abundance mentality.

This group is designed to bring like-minded women together so they can support each other's personal growth so they can reach their dreams and goals. 

We will meet monthly and also have some social outings in order to get to know each other better.

results.description:
Join us at the second NJ Music Networking Mixer of 2016! 

Come to socialize with fellow music industry people - musicians, bloggers, producers, label execs, DJs, graphic designers, photographers, and others. 

Meet. Mingle. Make new friends. Be inspired. Network. Learn new things!

We have a great location with our own separate party room! There's also free chips and salsa and $2 tacos! 

GIFT BAGS!
We are putting together gift bags for attendees. If you have any promotional items, stickers, download cards, business cards, flyers, etc. that you would like to include in these bags so that everyone goes home with your stuff, please contact any of the organizers of this event so we can provide you with information as to how you can send it in.

MUSIC SAMPLERS!
We are also putting together music samplers to include in the gift bags so if you have any new music that you would like to include on the sampler, message an organizer and we'll send you the upload link. 

RSVPs REQUIRED
Since this is a networking event, and people often attend specifically to meet people who do certain things, we require all attendees to RSVP for the event. Also, because we have our own party space reserved, attendance is limited to the capacity of the room. So your name must be on the guest list to attend. 

PLUS ONES
There are no plus ones on the guest list. We encourage you to bring along other industry-related professionals who should RSVP as a separate attendee. Because the goal of this event is to have a chance to meet and mingle with new people, we kindly request that non-music related plus ones are kept to a minimum because we have found that it discourages interaction among members. If you absolutely must bring a non-music plus one, they must be RSVP'd as a separate attendee. 

PLEASE NOTE:
This is not a performance event or a jam session so there's no need to bring instruments or gear. There are other Meetup groups that specialize in that kind of thing. This event is an opportunity for exchanging ideas, information, and meeting other music people. We look forward to seeing you again! Or meeting you for the first time! 

SPONSORS
Want to be a sponsor? Contact us.
results.name: NJ Music Industry Networking Mixer

results.description:
Session Abstract:

SharePoint server side developers and administrators know how powerful PowerShell is when it comes to farm administration and management of sites. if something can be done with server OM API, it can be done via PowerShell. But, how about SharePoint On-line?


Microsoft is kind enough to provide us with a suite of PowerShell commands called 'SharePoint Online management shell'. SharePoint Online Management Shell is a Windows PowerShell module that you can use to efficiently manage SharePoint Online users, sites, site collections, and organizations. However, it provides very limited administrative functionality and most of the administration activities are not supported. this is where we can use the power of PowerShell with CSOM managed API. in this session I will demonstrate how .NET client OM can be used with PowerShell to manage your SharePoint Online site with ease.

About Our Speaker:

I am a hands-on technical Solutions Architect primarily focused on delivering efficient and competitive business solutions on SharePoint Technology platform. I’m passionate about the relationship between business and technology, and how the latest technology can be leveraged to solve critical business problems by providing effective tools and solutions.

I have been in the IT industry for well over 14 years and have been working with SharePoint technologies for more than 10+ years. In my previous engagements, I was involved in providing strategy, implementation and support guidance to wide range of clients in various industries including Insurance, Pharmaceutical, Health and Manufacturing and gained wealth of domain knowledge in those industries.

As a SharePoint evangelist, I am also involved in SharePoint community activities. I am a speaker at SharePoint Saturday events and heavily involved in promoting and evangelizing SharePoint product by presenting at various SharePoint users groups (NJSPUG, CTSPUG) in the tri-state area.

http://www.risingskyline.com/speaking/
results.name: SharePoint Online Administration and Automation with CSOM and PowerShell

results.description:
Alvin Richards, VP of Product, Aerospike

Free beer & drinks, candy, swag, $100 Amazon raffle and more!

A Database Month event http://www.DBMonth.com/database/nosql-docker

In this talk we will review what Docker is and why it is important to developers, admins and DevOps when they are using a NoSQL Database.

We also cover:


• Why persistence is a critical element for a successful multi-container strategy

• Using Docker to orchestrate a multi container application using Flask and Aerospike

• Injecting HAProxy and other production requirements while we deploy to production

• Scaling web and database clusters to grow to meet demand

This lively presentation will include an interactive demo showcasing the core Docker components (Machine, Engine, Swarm and Compose) along with integration with Aerospike.

Alvin Richards, VP of Product, Aerospike

Alvin Richards is the VP of Product at Aerospike. In his previous lives, he served as the engineering lead for commercial products at Docker and technical director at MongoDB.

In more ancient history, Alvin held various engineering leadership roles at SaaS Credit Card processing (Deem), Database & Storage integration (NetApp), Database Archiving (Outerbay) and Data Warehousing (Oracle).

In addition to a B.Sc in Computer Science from the University of West London, Alvin also earned a B.A. in Photography from Nottingham Trent University.

Swag giveaway + food/drinks at 6:30pm
Power-Networking at 6:35pm 
Presentation starts at 6:40pm

Did you know that Techie Youth is the ONE-AND-ONLY organization providing career-opportunities to severely-at-risk foster-youth in New York?

Techie Youth is a 501c3 not-for-profit charity of NYC that provides technology-education, followed by assistance beginning an IT-career, to at-risk youth in NYC & Long Island who are in foster-care and classified as being severely-at-risk of becoming homeless and/or incarcerated in the next 18-24 months.

These kids need YOU, they have nobody else.
Please help them. Learn about Nadine, a student of Techie Youth: http://www.TechieYouth.org/hope
results.name: NoSQL Databases & Docker Containers: From Development to Deployment

results.description:
Come join us for a Kickoff/Demonstration meeting

Observe a program of impromptu speaking, prepared speeches and evaluations. Meet special guests and be a part of a unique experience.

Please RSVP here: https://toastmasterkickoffparty.splashthat.com/

Learn what Toastmasters has to offer – improved speaking ability, faster thinking in impromptu settings, and better leadership skills are just a few of the benefits. Make this occasion a success by attending

Astoria Toastmasters is anticipated to meet at WeWork in Astoria. 
You can view pics of the space at the following link:
https://www.wework.com/locations/new-york-city/studio-square

About Toastmasters International: 
Toastmasters International (TI) is a nonprofit educational organization that operates clubs worldwide for the purpose of helping members improve their communication, public speaking, and leadership skills. As of August 2015, there are more than 332,000 members and over 15,400 clubs in 135 countries, with annual membership growth of 5.9% and an increase of 4.1% in new clubs. Membership has grown consecutively every year since 1993. Toastmasters members belong to local clubs, which generally have between 10 and 40 members, with 20 members being a typical size. The local clubs meet on a regular basis for members to practice various skills useful in public speaking, including giving speeches, speaking impromtu, listening, and providing each other with feedback and evaluation. Some clubs meet monthly, some meet twice a month, and some meet weekly.

Membership is open to all people ages 18 and above wishing to improve their communications and leadership skills. Youths interested in these skills are served through the Youth Leadership and Gavel Club programs. Club Members are also allowed to speak or officiate in other clubs worldwide

for more inforation visit:
http://www.toastmasters.org/
results.how_to_find_us: Check in on the 2nd Floor
results.name: Toastmasters International Kickoff Party

results.description:
Apache NiFi is an easy to use, powerful, and reliable system to process and distribute data. It supports highly configurable directed graphs of data routing, transformation, and system mediation logic. Some of NiFi's key features include a web-based user interface for monitoring and controlling data flows, guaranteed delivery, data provenance, and easy extensibility through custom processor development. These features make NiFi a perfect candidate for building production quality data pipelines that interact with Apache Solr. This talk will demonstrate how to use a NiFi processor that delivers data to a Solr update handler, as well as a processor for extracting data from Solr on regular intervals for delivery to down-stream systems. In addition we will show how these processors can be combined with other built-in NiFi processors to solve a variety of use cases, including log aggregation, and indexing messages received from Kafka.

Speaker Bio

Bryan Bende is a Member of Technical Staff at Hortonworks where he develops dataflow capabilities around the core framework of Apache NiFi. He has over ten years of experience developing enterprise software solutions with Java and supporting technologies. Bryan received a B.S. in Computer Science from the University of Maryland at College Park, and a M.S. in Computer Science from John Hopkins University.
results.name: Building Data Pipelines for Solr with Apache NiFi

Pete Wassell - The latest and greatest from around the world of augmented reality


Presentation & Demo from Alexander Gredysa of VR Global 

VR Global is a diversified collective of talented and award winning technology, strategy, storytelling and creative specialists who are passionate about delivering the best immersive experiences for our clients and partners.


Amir Baradaran, Visual Artist, will do a survey of past works and talk about a large scale public art project. Presentation Title: Why Am I Responsible?  {AR}tist's Role in Augmenting Our Realities 

Baradaran’s praxis has inspired academic researchers, art professionals and technology developers alike for its articulation of visual vocabularies that use Augmented Reality (AR) technology around notions of interactivity, data-mining, failed utopias and the ephemeral. Baradaran is the recipient of the International Symposium on Mixed and Augmented Reality first place prize. Frenchising Mona Lisa (AR installation/infiltration in the Louvre) was featured on the cover of ArtinAmerica.com and he is currently working on a large-scale interactive Augmented Reality public AR(t) installation in South Florida.

results.description:
Intercambio is an “exchange” (as translated in English) of language and culture in a friendly atmosphere. The primary purpose is to provide an open forum for both English and Spanish learners to practice their conversational skills with native speakers. Intercambio is an essential compliment to formal language study, as it exposes participants to everyday dialects, idiomatic expressions and usages that are best explained by a native speaker.
Everyone is welcome!
results.name: Intercambio - Spanish/English language exchange

results.description:
Alvin Richards, VP of Product, Aerospike

Free beer & drinks, junk food, swag and more!

A Database Month event http://www.DBMonth.com/database/nosql-docker

In this talk we will review what Docker is and why it is important to developers, admins and DevOps when they are using a NoSQL Database.

We also cover: • Why persistence is a critical element for a successful multi-container strategy

• Using Docker to orchestrate a multi container application using Flask and Aerospike

• Injecting HAProxy and other production requirements while we deploy to production

• Scaling web and database clusters to grow to meet demand

This lively presentation will include an interactive demo showcasing the core Docker components (Machine, Engine, Swarm and Compose) along with integration with Aerospike.

Alvin Richards, VP of Product, Aerospike

Alvin Richards is the VP of Product at Aerospike. In his previous lives, he served as the engineering lead for commercial products at Docker and technical director at MongoDB.

In more ancient history, Alvin held various engineering leadership roles at SaaS Credit Card processing (Deem), Database & Storage integration (NetApp), Database Archiving (Outerbay) and Data Warehousing (Oracle).

In addition to a B.Sc in Computer Science from the University of West London, Alvin also earned a B.A. in Photography from Nottingham Trent University.

Swag giveaway + food/drinks at 6:30pm
Power-Networking at 6:35pm
Presentation starts at 6:40pm

Did you know that Techie Youth is the ONE-AND-ONLY organization providing career-opportunities to severely-at-risk foster-youth in New York?

Techie Youth is a 501c3 not-for-profit charity of NYC that provides technology-education, followed by assistance beginning an IT-career, to at-risk youth in NYC & Long Island who are in foster-care and classified as being severely-at-risk of becoming homeless and/or incarcerated in the next 18-24 months.

These kids need YOU, they have nobody else.
Please help them. Learn about Nadine, a student of Techie Youth: http://www.TechieYouth.org/hope

results.description:
Dear Dharma Drink Friends,


Our dinner discussion topic will be on Vegetarian/Veganism (“veg”) in Buddhism.  Fittingly we will be going to a delicious vegetarian/vegan meal at Kalash Parbat (info below).   

Many friends ask, “Are all Buddhists veg?” or “Why are not all Buddhists veg?”  Doesn’t the very first precept state not to kill?  These are great questions!

Indeed, the first precept of not killing is not violating or harming the lives of the others.  Buddha banned the sacrifices and advised his followers to extend their loving-kindness to all living beings.  In the Lankavatara Sutra, meat is for wild beasts and not for bodhisattvas.  Many Buddhist are vegetarian because they do not want to incur harm to other sentient being and others want to cultivate their mind for compassion.

However many Buddhists do eat meat.  In China, Taiwan, Vietnam, and Korean, while generally the Buddhist monastics do not eat meat, many of the practitioners do. During certain days of the year they refrain from meat consumption, similar to the Christian’s Lent.  In the traditions of Tibetan, Japanese, and Theravada such as in Thailand, some monastics eat meat.  Due to their geographic and cultural circumstance, meat consumption is a mainstay.  

For the Tibetans, they live in a nomadic culture high in the mountains where vegetables are not available year round.  Note that now many temples in the Tibetan tradition now forbid meat in their kitchens and many monastics are now vegetarian.  For the Theravada traditions, monastics must go for alms begging, where they eat whatever that’s given to them which may include meat.  The meat should be the left over and the monastics cannot eat meat where the animals are specifically killed for them.  

In terms of karmic retribution, the killing of another human being is the most serious, grave prohibitions or parajikas, and does not permit repentance, whereas the killing of other animals the karmic retribution is less severe.  There is also the intent of killing other animal, such as if it is the only to sustain one's life.  There are even some Tantra text referencing meat offerings, though some commentaries states that “meat” references solid food.  And there are plenty of Tantra texts that states don’t eat meat.  

While there are many reasons for eating meat, for the practitioners, it is important to reflect upon their own actions, to be mindful as to diminish suffering of others.  Tibetan Monk Matthew Ricard, Ph D, recommends everyone to watch Earthling and Food Inc documentaries, “Watch with open mind .. any decent human beings … just can’t do it (eat meat)”

_/|\_

Eddie

The Core Teachings, Venerable Master Hsing Yun

Zen Wisdom, Chan Master Sheng Yen

A Manual of Buddhism, Venerable Narada Maha Thera

http://www.shabkar.org/download/video/Matthieu_Ricard_02.htm

http://www.tonglen.oceandrop.org/Karma_&_Eating_Meat.htm

---- Kailash Parbat ----

Kailash Parbat is an international vegetarian/vegan chain with restaurants in Mumbai, Singapore, London and now New York.  While you may see many southern Indian veg restaurant in Curry Hill serving dosa, this restaurant comes from the Sindhi tradition and it is famous for their street food chaat.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be inside!  Look for us!
results.name: Dinner & Discussion: Buddhism and Vegan/Vegetarianism

results.description:
Test Masters Academy hosts a social event to celebrate the 1st Annual Test Leadership Congress and Masterclasses week: TestMastersAcademy.org

Our guests are conference and masterclasses speakers.

Special appearance: Elizabeth Zagroba with the presentation "Testing When The World Is Watching". The abstract:

Your social media accounts are the most visible part of your company. Embarrassing complaints there are make-or-break for gathering new customers and keeping up appearances. You get a bug report from a user on Twitter. The user hasn’t crammed clear steps to reproduce and their environment information into 140 characters. You have their frustration, and if you’re lucky, where the error occurred. You need to respond quickly to prove to the world that you care about your users. Now what?

We’ll figure out how to better serve our real-life customers and the developers trying to resolve their issues when the messages they’ve left you are cut off or garbled. We’ll work through some examples to come to a better understanding of:

* How to name or label views so users can report back where a specific problem occurred.

* How crashes detract from the charisma of the product and break down trust with the user.

* What to write in a bug report to pique a developer’s curiosity.

* Why managing customer feedback is worth your time and effort.
results.name: April Meetup: Test Masters Academy social event

results.description: Shuai Shao and Trung Le of the University of Pennsylvania will present the key new features of the upcoming WebGL 2 specification and present their work on the WebGL 2 Sample Pack. WebGL 2 will allow more sophisticated 3D graphics techniques to be performed in the browser by giving the WebGL context access to more modern GPU features such as 3D textures and multiple render targets. The WebGL 2 Sample Pack is a collection of concise examples of how to use each new WebGL 2 feature, and is thus a powerful learning resource for WebGL developers wanting to take advantage of the new spec.
results.name: Introduction to WebGL 2

results.description:
Join us for an incredible private wine tasting with several other similar Meetup groups. Meet in a private wine cellar and taste wines from all over the world. We will have both red and white wines along with light appetizers.

There will also be detailed written tasting notes and the ability to purchase similar wines in an adjacent wine store at a special discount for our members.

If you're new to wine or a die hard fan, it's a great experience for all. This is such a fun wine tasting that sells out every time!

*PREPAY ONLY EVENT. Must purchase ticket in advance at this link below (limited space and no tickets sold at door) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Apr-26-2016_at_0630PM

*Tickets start are just $35 (goes to $45 as event gets closer). This event sells out every time so don't wait to get tickets. 

Can I come alone? Yes about 90% will attend on their own. 

Do I need to know about wine? No, most come for socializing, learning and the enjoyment of wine.

What's dress code? Wear what you had on at work. It is a casual and comfortable atmosphere. 

What are the ages? This is non-age specific event and is not meant to be gender balanced. We'll have a good mix of ages 20s-50s. Everyone always seems to find people in their peer group to hang and taste with. 

How many will be attending? This is being co-organized by several Meetup groups. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. Based on pre-sales already, we will have at least 25+ members attending! 

Do I have to buy a ticket in advance? Yes. Space is limited and this will sell out. An RSVP alone will not hold your spot. You must purchase a ticket at this link to be confirmed - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Apr-26-2016_at_0630PM
results.name: Private Wine Tasting Social w/ Appetizers (PREPAY ONLY)

Can I come alone? Yes about 90% will attend on their own. 

Do I need to know about wine? No, most come for socializing, learning and the enjoyment of wine.

What's dress code? Wear what you had on at work. It is a casual and comfortable atmosphere. 

What are the ages? This is non-age specific event and is not meant to be gender balanced. We'll have a good mix of ages 20s-50s. Everyone always seems to find people in their peer group to hang and taste with. 

How many will be attending? This is being co-organized by several Meetup groups. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. Based on pre-sales already, we will have at least 25+ members attending! 

Do I have to buy a ticket in advance? Yes. Space is limited and this will sell out. An RSVP alone will not hold your spot. You must purchase a ticket at this link to be confirmed - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Apr-26-2016_at_0630PM

results.name: Conducting Our First Experiment

results.description:
Come out and play some games, hang out, have fun and may be make some new friends.


Leave a comment if you are bringing any games. But it's OK if you do not. We'll  have enough games for everyone to play. If you are new to games, we'll teach you how to play. New-comers are always welcome.

If your plans change and you can't make it, please update your RSVP. And please do not just show up without RSVP.

Come join our board game Facebook group to stay in touch.

https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/

The venue we are using is a business and we want them to be glad to have us there. Please support them by making purchases while we are using their establishment whenever possible. Thank you.
results.name: Tuesday Board Game meet up in Astoria

results.description:
The Rockland County Makerspace offers weekly Arduino workshops with Dr. Duncan Bell, who has extensive experience in building many types of Arduino-based projects. 

Dr. Bell will bring multiple types of Arduinos and shields, motors and lights, and even computers for the attendees to play with in a hands-on environment. Bring your own project ideas, and Dr. Bell will be happy to help you out. 

The cost is $10
Tuesdays from 6:30 to 8:30 PM
results.name: Arduino Workshop

results.description:
Given by Yasuko Kasaki
Tuesdays from 6:30 – 7 pm
Free

Please join us in the sharing of miracles. Here, your mind can come to rest and you can remember true peace. No experience with meditation is required, and everyone is welcome. We ask only that you make it your intention to sit still, quiet in body and mind, and to listen to; receive and follow my instruction to the best of your ability. You will learn to meditate as you practice. Please arrive for Meditation before 6:30 pm as we don't allow latecomers to enter.

We at CRS are dedicated teachers and students of A Course in Miracles (ACIM) who are waiting to share miracles with you through our ACIM Healing. We ask the Holy Spirit to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and we share forgiveness and bear witness to the miracles that are happening in your life. Each week I will share with you a different inspirational message from Holy Spirit. This may take the form of creative visualization exercises, or instruction about the nature and purpose of meditation, or about our true nature and relationship to ourselves, to one another, and to the world. In a sense, this is both a meditation practice and a meditation class.

Some students have been coming regularly for a number of years. Others drop in and out as they have time or need. Some come to learn and grow, others more so simply to calm down, to take time out from the frenetic pace of their busy lives. If you are new and feeling uncertain or shaky, do not hesitate to introduce yourself to some of the other students, to ask questions before or after. Try to observe and emulate the stillness and concentration of others around you whom you sense are most grounded. Soon, you, in turn, may provide inspiration and guidance for others.

While the principles are based on ACIM, it does not matter if you are unfamiliar with ACIM or are not prepared to study it outside of this meditation. You can still take from this practice some very practical, effective lessons, tools, and experiences that can enable you to lead a more peaceful, purposeful, fulfilling and loving life.

Namaste,

Yasuko Kasaki,
Founder
CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing)
123 4th Ave, 2nd FL (between 12th & 13th streets, above Think Coffee)
New York, NY 10003
[masked]
www.crsny.org
results.name: ACIM-Based Guided Meditation

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
